job title: Bristol Myers Squibb, Intern, Bioinformatics (Summer 2023) - Application via WayUp
job description: This role is with Bristol Myers Squibb. WayUp is partnering with Bristol Myers Squibb to hire top talent.At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.Position SummaryWe are seeking a highly motivated student to join our group for a 10-week long summer internship program. A successful candidate will work with their mentor to create an ensemble of machine learning approaches to accurately identify short tandem repeats (STR) in the genome of patients. STRs have a recognized role in several phenotypes including amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), Huntington’s disease, myotonic dystrophies, etc. Multiple computational approaches exist that report the presence of pre-determined STRs in specific genomic loci. However, these computational approaches do not reach a perfect consensus of the set of the reported STRs on the same Next Generation Sequencing and Genome Wide Sequencing data. To fill this gap, the candidate will leverage published scientific literature to generate a set of well supported STRs and implement predictive approaches to construct an ensemble for detecting STRs. Further, the candidate will also explore the validity of the approach with business relevant cohorts. The candidate will have the opportunity to work with an interdisciplinary team of experienced bioinformaticians, collaborate with biologists and learn about the complexity of drug target discovery.Key Responsibilities Participate in designing a set of verified ground truth from published scientific literature that will assist in the construction of predictive approaches for detecting genomic expansionsExplore a range of features that could be useful in detecting correct genomic expansions reported by multiple computational toolsConstruct an ensemble of predictive algorithms to detect genomic expansions with higher confidenceBuild disease specific and patient specific set of STRsProvide written documentation and specifications for developed methods and workflowsExpect to present to large audience at the completion of the internshipQualifications & Experience Currently enrolled in a graduate program in computer science, statistics, bioinformatics, life sciences or a similar fieldFluency with Linux, docker and AWS cloud computingExperience with machine learning packages like scikit-learnExperience with benchmarking predictive computational methods; familiarity with evaluation metricsGood programming skills using scripting languages (e.g., Python, R/Bioconductor) and notebooks (e.g. R markdown, Jupyter notebook)Experience with analyzing WGS data to explore genomic expansions is a plusExcellent verbal and communication skillsMust be able to work full-time for the program duration Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues. Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.Physical presence at the BMS worksite or physical presence in the field is an essential job function of this role which the Company deems critical to collaboration, innovation, productivity, employee well-being and engagement, and enhances the Company culture. To protect the safety of our workforce, customers, patients and communities, the policy of the Company requires all employees and workers in the U.S. and Puerto Rico to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless they have received an exception based on an approved request for a medical or religious reasonable accommodation.Therefore, all BMS applicants seeking a role located in the U.S. and Puerto Rico must confirm that they have already received or are willing to receive the full COVID-19 vaccination by their start date as a qualification of the role and condition of employment.This requirement is subject to state and local law restrictions and may not be applicable to employees working in certain jurisdictions such as Montana. This requirement is also subject to discussions with collective bargaining representatives in the U.S. Our company is committed to ensuring that people with disabilities can excel through a transparent recruitment process, reasonable workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Applicants can request an approval of accommodation prior to accepting a job offer. job title: Bristol Myers Squibb, Intern, Computational Biology (Summer 2023) - Application via WayUp
job description: This role is with Bristol Myers Squibb. WayUp is partnering with Bristol Myers Squibb to hire top talent.At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.Position SummaryWe are seeking a highly motivated student to join our group for a 10-week long summer internship program. A successful candidate will work with their mentor to adopt, develop, and apply multi-omics integration methods to assess novel molecular determinants of drug sensitivity. In particular, the goal will be to evaluate and build upon data integration methods such as contrastive principal component analysis (Abid, Nat Commun 2018) and DeepDEP (Chiu, Sci Adv 2021) to develop transferable predictive models that take routine omics measurements such as gene expression or genetic variation for the prediction of cell-intrinsic properties (gene dependencies or metastatic potential) as well as pharmacological profiles including compound sensitivities. Training of these models will be performed mainly on in vitro models and should be generalizable to more complex systems (e.g., organoids and primary tumors) based on recent work estimating gene essentially in primary tumors using TCGA-CCLE aligned transcriptomes (Shi, bioRxiv 2022). Critical to this procedure will be the biologically informed exclusion of signals arising from known discrepancies between systems such as stromal and immune components separating in vivo and in vitro contexts. The proposed work will finally leverage in-house molecular profiles to facilitate rapid in silico discovery of novel combinatorial drivers underlying disease progression and treatment response, ultimately having the potential to broadly accelerate diverse R&D efforts. Throughout this process, the candidate will have the opportunity to learn from experienced computational biologists, exercise their skills in bioinformatics, and learn about the process of R&D in an industry setting.Key Responsibilities Research and benchmark supervised/unsupervised data integration methods as applied to gene expression and other modalities from public resourcesOrganize and compile a database of internal and external omics datasets to enable large-scale data mining effortsLeverage integrated omics profiles to translate and generalize experimental findings across cancer models (e.g., cell lines, xenografts, tumors)Develop effective means of visualization (e.g., in the form of dashboards) to summarize and communicate dataset characteristics and predictive model outputsQualifications & Experience Experience in programming with Python or R as well as common statistical frameworks in the corresponding language (e.g., scikit-learn, tidymodels)Working knowledge of statistical modelling or machine learning is strongly preferredFamiliarity with different omics modalities is a plusExperience with data visualization in both static (e.g., ggplot2, matplotlib/seaborn) and interactive (e.g., Plotly, Bokeh, D3) formatsCurrently enrolled in a MS/PhD program in computer science, bioinformatics, statistics, physics, or a similar fieldMust be able to work full-time for the program durationExcellent verbal and communication skills Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues. Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.Physical presence at the BMS worksite or physical presence in the field is an essential job function of this role which the Company deems critical to collaboration, innovation, productivity, employee well-being and engagement, and enhances the Company culture. To protect the safety of our workforce, customers, patients and communities, the policy of the Company requires all employees and workers in the U.S. and Puerto Rico to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless they have received an exception based on an approved request for a medical or religious reasonable accommodation.Therefore, all BMS applicants seeking a role located in the U.S. and Puerto Rico must confirm that they have already received or are willing to receive the full COVID-19 vaccination by their start date as a qualification of the role and condition of employment.This requirement is subject to state and local law restrictions and may not be applicable to employees working in certain jurisdictions such as Montana. This requirement is also subject to discussions with collective bargaining representatives in the U.S. Our company is committed to ensuring that people with disabilities can excel through a transparent recruitment process, reasonable workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Applicants can request an approval of accommodation prior to accepting a job offer. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application or if you are applying to a role based in the U.S. or Puerto Rico and you believe that you are unable to receive a COVID-19 vaccine due to a medical condition or sincerely held religious belief, during or any part of the recruitment process, please direct your inquiries to adastaffingsupport@bms.com. Job TitleHealth Systems Informatics Analyst 2DepartmentVeterinary Medicine | College AdministrationThe College of Veterinary Medicine is seeking an experienced Health Systems Informatics Analyst 2 with excellent customer service skills to act as a primary contributor and consultant for veterinary patient care services related to the planning, design, development, implementation, maintenance, user training and optimization of integrated clinical information systems (EMR, LIS, RIS, other) related to the strategic mission of the College of Veterinary Medicine and the Veterinary Medical Center. This role may function as an evaluator, trainer, project manager or facilitator for changes related to operations within the clinical environment and may also act as a consultant on clinical workflows.This role will include project management; integration of devices and systems; use of APIs for data exchange; and collaboration with other staff and system vendors. Provides business intelligence (queries, reports, dashboards) serving the clinical and business needs of the College. Some work may be required outside of normal business hours such as after-hours system maintenance and emergency user or system support.RequirementsBachelor's degree in computer and information science or equivalent experience. 2 years of relevant experience required. 2-4 years of relevant experience preferred.Strong communications skills both oral and written; experience in a multi-platform environment, excellent working knowledge of Windows and Cloud based systems; working knowledge of hospital computing environments including EMR and Laboratory systems. Expertise in system integration management such as HL7 and ASTM. Understand basic concepts around Application Programming Interfaces (API). Vendor management experience.Experience with Windows and Linux operating systems; scripting/programming with Python, Mirth, and Java;expertise with clinical systems including Instrument Manager, E-Film PACS, VetRocket, Dragon Naturally Speaking, DICOM, MSSQL and PostgreSQL database queries for clinical, business and research support.Additional InformationPhysical Requirements: Ability to move laboratory equipment from time to timeLocation:Veterinary Medical Center (0299)Position TypeRegularScheduled Hours40ShiftFirst ShiftFinal candidates are subject to successful completion of a background check. As a team member in the Finance and Internal Audit department at Nationwide, the opportunities are endless! You can grow and learn in diverse areas across many disciplines such as Advanced Analytics, Investments, Actuarial, Accounting, Risk Management, Critical Business Advisor and so much more. Let Nationwide help create your career journey!Internal Compensation Grade: G5Location: This position can be filled as Hybrid or RemoteAdditional RequirementsThis role requires applied, relevant full-time employment experience. As an Analytic Science Consultant, you will have the opportunity to lead large-scale, complex analytic projects and initiatives supporting the Enterprise Analytics Office. We are seeking candidates with deep technical knowledge in their field of study with an established, consistent track record of delivering high-quality, high-value analytic work. Candidates should be able to take the initiative to proactively identify current business partner needs and develop new and innovative solutions. Candidates for this position should demonstrate a history of collaborating across working teams and departments to obtain alignment and achieve project & business objectives. We seek candidates who embody the philosophy of being lifelong learners. We seek candidates who help contribute to the development of others, not just themselves. Candidates must be able to go outside of their comfort zone and actively pursue stretch opportunities. As a Consultant, we'll expect you to think of the bigger picture and take on increasingly complex roles in aligning project work to the broader corporate strategy.For candidates seeking entry-level, full-time employment work with either no prior work experience or with internship-only experience, please refer to our entry-level position at https://nationwide.wd1.myworkdayjobs.com/Nationwide_Career/job/Ohio---Columbus-Metro/Specialist--Analytic-Scientist--Data-Scientist-_75757Nationwide pays based on a geographic-specific salary structure. The actual salary for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role as well as the cost of labor in the market; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. If a Sales job, Sales Incentives, based on performance goals are possible in addition to this range. The role may also be eligible for either short-term or long-term incentive plans based on business and/or position-specific results. Newly hired full-time associates receive a minimum of 18 days paid time off each full calendar year, pro-rated quarterly based on hire date. Newly hired full-time associates at higher job levels may receive additional paid time off. You will also receive 8 hours of Lifetime paid time off and 8 hours of Unity Day paid time off. The range for this role is listed below.In Washington, the salary range for Consultant, Analytic Scientist is $99,000.00 to $191,000.00.Job Description SummaryDo you have the desire to play a critical role in driving data-based business outcomes? At Nationwide, our Analytic Scientists are responsible for modeling complex problems, discovering insights and identifying business opportunities using scientific research methods, statistics, machine learning and data visualization techniques. We value a dedication to lifelong learning and strong quantitative judgment. If you are a methodological generalist who is adept at applying your technical skill set to a wide range of business applications, we want to know more about you!As a Consultant, you’ll need to have a strong grasp of business objectives and work consultatively with business partners to develop solutions. You may work on multiple concurrent projects and often lead small teams of modelers. You’ll participate in all phases of the analytic lifecycle, from research design, data collection and data processing to model building, deployment and presentation of results. We’ll count on you to be fully proficient with advanced statistical and machine learning techniques and exhibit a deep knowledge of technical domains or modeling approaches.Job DescriptionKey Responsibilities:Serves as the lead modeler on larger projects or works on concurrent projects that involve the design, development, implementation and monitoring of statistical and machine learning models.Consults with business partners to understand, define and deliver work that meets their needs and delivers timely results.Integrates relevant research findings to generate hypotheses and help business partners make informed decisions.Applies knowledge of advanced quantitative techniques to analyze any given data structure.Builds predictive and explanatory models to generate actionable insights and practical solutions to business problems.Crafts results that provide clear and concise summaries of findings and recommendations using impactful storylines and data visualization geared to both technical and non-technical audiences.Upholds a high standard for methodological rigor, sound statistical inference and robust model validation.Identifies creative solutions to complex business problems of broad scope and business impact.May Perform Other Responsibilities As Assigned.Reporting Relationships: Reports to Senior Consultant, Director. This is an individual contributor role and may manage interns/GRAs as assigned.Typical Skills And ExperiencesEducation: Preferred: Graduate studies in statistics, engineering, math, quantitative social science fields or related areas. Proven experience building and deploying machine learning and/or statistical models or executing quantitative research studies may be considered in lieu of formal education.Experience: Typically, five or more years of related work experience in a relevant field.Knowledge, Abilities And SkillsQuantitative judgment: Experience building and deploying machine learning and/or statistical models.Research methods: Knowledge of multiple quantitative research and analysis approaches and their tradeoffs.Programming ability: Python, R, SQL, or any other transferrable language (MATLAB, Java, etc.).Communication skills: Ability to communicate predictive modeling with business partners to modeling experts. Capable of developing compelling stories and distinctive data visualizations.Passion, inquisitiveness, creativity, self-starters and team builders.Other criteria, including leadership skills, competencies and experiences may take precedence.Staffing exceptions to the above must be approved by the Vice President and HR Vice President.Values: Regularly and consistently demonstrates the Nationwide Values.Job ConditionsOvertime Eligibility: Exempt (Not Eligible)Working Conditions: Normal office environmentADA: The above statements cover what are generally believed to be principal and essential functions of this job. To learn more about the benefits we offer, click here.Nationwide is an equal opportunity employer. Information Security Internship (multiple positions available)Employee Status: InternSchedule: SeasonalLocation: Westfield Center, OH, hybrid schedule or RemoteAbout UsYou’re ready to make your mark where people care about each other. Where your work is meaningful. And where your unique perspectives are welcome. Think about joining Westfield, a company focused on what’s most important – the people behind our policies.Westfield was founded in 1848 by a small group of hard-working farmers who believed in the promise of the future and the power of the individual. Today, as one of the nation’s leading property and casualty (P&C) companies, we remain true to their vision and are dedicated to making a positive difference in our customers lives.ResponsibilitiesThe Information Security internship is designed to enable learning and personal development for those that have a passion to pursue a career in Information Security. In addition, this opportunity will provide exposure to a variety of security disciplines and technologies. Security Operations Intern: Assist the Security Operations Center (SOC) by learning and leveraging various security technologies (e.g., SIEM, IPS) for the purpose of detecting and responding to potential cyber-attacks and/or other anomalous network activity. Perform security incident triage, to include determining scope, urgency, and potential impact. Assist with optimizing the SOC using security orchestration automation and response (SOAR) methods and technology. Work on various information security projects and initiatives. Threat & Vulnerability Management Intern: Assist the Threat and Vulnerability Management (TVM) team by driving security vulnerability identification, assessment/rating, and remediation using vulnerability scanning and management technologies/procedures. Actively research & report against emerging indicators of compromise, cyber-attacks, exploits, and vulnerabilities through threat modeling methods and cyber intelligence sources. Work on various information security projects and initiatives. Governance Risk & Compliance (GRC) Intern: Work within the corporate-wide Information Security GRC program, assessing IT and cybersecurity risks and identifying emerging cybersecurity threats. Partner with Information Technology, Enterprise Risk Management (ERM), Legal, Human Resources and Procurement to ensure appropriate controls are in place to minimize risk and ensure compliance with Information Security Policy, Standards and Controls, NIST CSF, CIS, and data privacy regulations. Support the vendor security risk management program by performing third-party security assessments. Performs risk assessments and gap analysis, to assist with development of a Risk Register. Work on various information security projects and initiatives. QualificationsActively pursuing an associate or bachelor’s degree with a related field of study (e.g., Computer Science, IT, Cyber-Security). Fundamental understanding of cybersecurity concepts. Basic level Python programming skills. Excellent troubleshooting and analytical skills, with a proven ability to think outside the box. Customer service-oriented with strong written and verbal communication skills. Must thrive within a team environment as well as on an individual basis. Passion for all things related to information technology and cybersecurity. Natural curiosity and ability to learn new skills quickly. Innovative mindset and driven to contribute to a team providing a best-in-class cybersecurity service. Proven ability to collaborate and work with a team. Demonstrated solid oral, written and interpersonal skills resulting in the ability to interact with all levels within the organization. Demonstrated organization skills. Demonstrated initiative and ability to work independently. Valid driver’s license and a driving record that conforms to company standards. Physical Requirements (specific to the role)The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.Ability to work effectively in an office environment, weekly (including sitting, standing and working on a computer for extended periods of time). Ability to communicate effectively in a collaborative work environment utilizing various technologies such as: telephone, computer, web, voice, teleconferencing, e-mail, etc. Ability to travel as required. Depending on assigned department, physical requirements may vary in severity. Enjoy a casual-dress atmosphere while taking advantage of a challenging and rewarding work environment. Our internship program starts your career and encourages you to set meaningful goals and objectives while you are with us. You will meet with key leaders, job shadow, make presentations and have fun along the way!Learn more about current opportunities at www.westfieldinsurance.com/careers.We are an equal opportunity employer/minority/female/disability/protected veteran.Show moreShow less

Job TitleResearch ScientistDepartmentMedicine | School Biomed Sci - Biomedical InformaticsResearch Scientist will function as an expert and resource in biomedical informatics research and contributes to service line work specifically in the analysis of Next Generation Sequencing for the Department of Biomedical Informatics; conceptualizes, designs, implements, evaluates, and directs research with regard to biomedical informatics; develops, adopts and implements new laboratory methods; develops hypothesis and experimental approach to hypothesis testing; participates as a team member with researchers to interpret data and discuss project progress; collaborates with other researchers in determining research priorities and planning programs of research; keeps up to date with relevant published literature; develops and writes research manuscripts, articles, and abstracts; writes project reports; presents ongoing work and findings at academic and international conferences; develops and conducts educational workshops, lectures and seminars; develops, writes and submits grant proposals of original research as principal investigator to extramural funding agencies to obtain significant salary and research support from outside funding agencies and to promote inclusion of biomedical informatics in proposals; directs and manages grant budgets; troubleshoots problems; advises staff and researchers on new technology and trends in biomedical informatics; manages and oversees the selection and design of research methodologies used for data analysis and establishes procedures; performs research for new methods and makes recommendations regarding research procedures; supervises graduate students and other members of staff; trains junior investigators, post doctoral researchers, graduate students and technicians within laboratory.Minimum Education RequiredDoctorate (Academic) or equivalent combination of education and experience with a Major in Biomedical SciencesRequired QualificationsDoctoral degree Biomedical Sciences, Computer Science, Electrical & Computer Engineering, Biomedical Informatics, Biology, or an equivalent combination of education & experience required; demonstrated ability to be a competent and productive researcher i.e. incumbent will have authored several publications of considerable interest & value to the field as evidenced by favorable reviews, by citation in the work of others, presentations of papers to professional societies, and/or contributed to inventions, new designs, or techniques which are of material significance in the solution of important applied problems. Requires successful completion of a background check. Selected candidate may be requested to complete a pre-employment physical including a drug screen.Additional InformationLocation:Lincoln Tower (0271)Position TypeRegularScheduled Hours40ShiftFirst ShiftFinal candidates are subject to successful completion of a background check. A drug screen or physical may be required during the post offer process.Thank you for your interest in positions at The Ohio State University and Wexner Medical Center. DescriptionTuvli, an Akima Company, is dedicated to providing our customers with superior, integrated technology and program support services and solutions. Our systems engineering, information technology, information assurance, program support and project management staff work closely with customers to ensure that our solutions are directly aligned with their business processes and desired program outcomes. We emphasize affordability, and delivering the best value for technology investments. Our personnel enjoy competitive benefits packages and challenging roles in work environments committed to innovation, diversity and opportunity for career growth. As an Alaska Native Corporation (ANC), 100% of our company's profits go back to our 14,300 Iñupiat shareholders that have resided near and above the Arctic Circle for more than 10,000 years. Our business helps support their way of life and contributes to the survival of a culture that has thrived in a challenging environment.Job Responsibilities Evaluates data and uses data analytics and data visualization to develop a variety of visually appealing and easy to interpret products to clearly communicate complex data sets and J/TIP priorities to the public and other stakeholders. Develops informational products such as charts, diagrams, maps, and graphics for senior management and other staff. Analyzes data and uses data visualization techniques to showcase human trafficking patterns and trends. This includes monitoring data quality and removing inaccurate data. Works closely with or advises all J/TIP teams to further the mission and priorities of the office related to this portfolio. The Data Analyst will also coordinate with other PE team members to make the office website and intranet Share Point site user-friendly, content-rich, and dynamic. This position will also support the development of reports and other written product for internal and external audiences. One example of this would be to perform statistical analysis of data for annual performance indicators. When needed, the Data Analyst will communicate, and may give presentations, on data and information to ensure staff understand data content.QualificationsMinimum Qualifications: Bachelors' degree (preferably in computer science or in a related field like math, statistics, or computer engineering). Ability to demonstrate capacity to work with large amounts of data, extract relevant information, and draw logical conclusions. Ability to translate complex data into non-technical, lay terms, especially for the general public. Demonstrated ability to pay attention to detail when working with data in order to highlight trends and patterns. Possesses subject matter expertise in knowledge of statistical methodologies and data analysis, and a comprehensive understanding of relevant databases, data sources, data organization. Skilled in Tableau, Share Point, and/or Microsoft Power BI. Expert in Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Office Suite. Previous experience or education in human rights or work with vulnerable populations. Demonstrated ability to communicate complex issues in a timely and concise manner, both orally and in written form. Strong IT and mathematical skills. Active Secret Clearance. 5-7 years of data analyst or related experience.The duties and responsibilities listed in this job description generally cover the nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this position. This is not intended to be a complete list of all duties, responsibilities, and skills required. Subject to the terms of an applicable collective bargaining agreement, the company management reserves the right to modify, add, or remove duties and to assign other duties as may be necessary. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.We are an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment, without regard to race, color, religion, creed, national origin, gender or gender-identity, age, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, pregnancy or parental status, or any other basis prohibited by law.We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you have a physical and/or mental disability and are interested in applying for employment and need special accommodations to use our website to apply for a position please contact, Recruiting Services at job-assist@akima.com or 571-353-7053. Reasonable accommodation requests are considered on a case-by-case basis.The dedicated email and telephonic options above are reserved only for individuals with disabilities needing accessibility assistance to apply to an open position using our website.Please do not use the dedicated email or phone number above to inquire on the status of your job application.In order for our company to stay compliant with government regulations, please apply online. Please DO NOT email resumes or call in lieu of applying online unless you have a physical and/or mental disability and need assistance with the online application.Job: Program & Project ManagementTravel: Yes, 25 % of the TimeOrganization: Tuvli, LLCClearance: SECRETShift: Day JobReq ID: TUV02806Show moreShow less

DescriptionTheDirector of Data & Analyticsoversees a team focused on managing analytics technologies, data assets, data visualization, data curation, and analytical models for both internal and external applications. We are seeking an individual with demonstratable experience leading data-centric teams with a focus on value-based and cost-of-care programs in partnership with clinical stakeholders. The ideal candidate can effectively create and execute on data strategies and analytics technology roadmaps as well as lead data architecture and analytical frameworks in large-scale data environments. A successful candidate will provide thought leadership and shepherd new technology solutions that will improve our analytics capabilities. This role is critical as it supports and maintains foundational analytics capabilities for the AIM Specialty Health and myNEXUS business units.How You Will Make An Impact Establish a data strategy and technology roadmap, leveraging a build, buy, partner framework to support the AIM Specialty Health and myNEXUS business units.Develop business cases to scale new analytics solutions, and associated resources (people, funding, technology) required to successfully deliver on analytics or business initiatives.Manage a team of associates whose primary purpose is developing and curating data, implementing new analytics solutions, and developing data visualizations to be used for analyzing business opportunities and monitoring performance.Quickly deploy data pipelines, APIs, and feeds from disparate data sources and operational software environments to support proof of concepts or MVP solutions.Bring a dev ops mindset to enable near real-time and batch-based analytical solutions that leverage new technologies.Establish and manage teams to a set of standards and governance to improve performance and support effective development/outputs across the analytics organization.Identify new ways to support and improve analytics development efforts across the team, which includes traditional BI and reporting as well as data science and machine learning.Leverage medical claims data sets to provide compelling datasets and recommendations to the analytics to support new analysis.Collaborate with analytics teams, business partners, and technology teams from product strategy, product management, data strategy, and data science perspective to develop effective solutions improving analytical capabilities.Continuously assess for opportunities, develop timelines, and action plans to mitigate potential risks, including escalations from customers.Ensure a high level of data quality, integrity, accuracy, and timeliness supporting analytics deliverables as well as maintaining/scaling existing data environments and complex ETL processesOversee prioritization and coordinate highly visible projects as well as management of a portfolio of solutions.Lead multi-departmental projects by closely coordinating technical and non-technical resources.Excellent critical thinking skills with a bias towards changing the status quo through fact-based analytics offerings.Proven track record of deploying effective talent management programs and establishing a high standard of performance for hybrid teams that work collaboratively on-site and/or remote. Requires Bachelor's degree and minimum of 9 years of experience in financial, utilization, and quality measures of health care, managed care information development, physician profiling reporting or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.Preferred Skills, Capabilities, And Experiences BS/BA degree in Business Information System, Computer Science, Engineering, or a quantitative-related field; minimum of 8-10 years related experience in an analytics environment supporting architecture, engineering and development of data applications and analytics solutions, or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.7+ years of experience working with cloud and on-prem databases, data lakes, and languages (i.e. Snowflake, Teradata, Sybase, Oracle, DB2, MS SQL, SQL, HQL, Hadoop, Python, Databricks, etc.)Strong knowledge of healthcare administrative and operational data, specifically prior authorization, patient, provider, eligibility, and medical claims data.Demonstrated experience in creating successful data strategies and environmentsLead and support product development organizations in a healthcare setting.Familiarity with product lifecycle standards and supporting go-to-market introductions through better data and analytics capabilities.Must be able to lead and facilitate sessions bringing together all relevant stakeholders to develop enterprise solutions.Experience specific to health insurance or health insurance claims data or graduate-level related education (MBA or MPH) may also be used to offset years of experience. Familiarity with medical management or population health programs is highly desired.Expert in Qlik, Tableau, and/or other data visualization tools/technologiesExperience launching solutions within Agile environmentsPossess working knowledge of healthcare data and measurement standards such as ICD10, CPT/HCPCS, MS-DRG, DxCG, PMPM, and utilization per 1,000Preference for candidates with healthcare analytics consulting experienceExperience managing data teams in a shared service analytics environment For candidates working in person or remotely in the below locations, the salary* range for this specific position is $132,720to $199,080.Locations: California; Colorado; Nevada; Washington State; Jersey City, NJ; New York City, NY; Ithaca, NY and Westchester County, NYIn addition to your salary, Elevance Health offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). The salary offered for this specific position is based on a number of legitimate, non-discriminatory factors set by the company. The company is fully committed to ensuring equal pay opportunities for equal work regardless of gender, race, or any other category protected by federal, state, and local pay equity laws. UES, Inc. has an opportunity available for a Bioinformatician with experience in microbial data science to join our team supporting the Air Force Research Laboratory near Dayton, OH. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work across multiple collaborative projects in the areas of microbiome science, synthetic biology products, and their applications. The selected candidate will develop standardized data processing pipelines to assemble, annotate, and perform comparative analyses of microbial communities as well as both bacteria and fungi to aid in generation of testable hypotheses. This role requires effective teamwork and communication of results with colleagues from diverse backgrounds. Functions for this role will also include:· Development and maintenance of scalable, reproducible bioinformatic data processing pipelines· Management of large repositories of multi’omic datasets· Assist in the analysis of enriched or natural complex microbial datasets generated from metagenomics and metatranscriptomics sequencing including tasks such as, but not limited to assembly, binning, annotation, enzyme mining, and phylogenetic analyses· Documentation and presentation of research progress in the forms of reports, publications, and oral presentations· Travel to scientific reviews and conferences Requirements:· M.Sc. (or Bachelor’s with 4+ years of relevant experience) in Computer Science, Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, or Microbial Genomics· Demonstrated success in applying open source software and in developing novel algorithms or workflows for the comparative analysis of genomes or microbial communities· Fluent in one or more major programming languages such as C, C++, Python, Perl, or Rust· Knowledge of statistical computing in R· Experience with distributed version control systems (e.g., Git) for code base development· Proficient in Unix-based command line environments· Experience in distributed computing environments such as HPC or cloud based systems is highly desirable· Experience with data processing pipeline development on AWS, GCP, Azure or other cloud computing environments is highly desirable· Previous experience in comparative genomics or an understanding of secondary metabolite biosynthesis is highly desirable· Experience in applying machine learning algorithms or statistical methods to solve biological problems is highly desirable· Demonstrated understanding of relevant public genomic databases· Ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team, and communicate results clearly to non-computational scientists· Excellent organizational skills· This position is working on-site at a government facility and requires U.S. citizenship Additional InformationUES, Inc. is an innovative science and technology company providing customers with superior research and development expertise since its inception in 1973. Our long-term success is a direct result of a strong commitment to the success of our employees. We look forward to reviewing your application.UES, Inc. is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.Show moreShow less

job title: Bristol Myers Squibb, Intern, Computational Biology (Summer 2023) - Application via WayUp
job description: This role is with Bristol Myers Squibb. WayUp is partnering with Bristol Myers Squibb to hire top talent.At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.Position SummaryWe are seeking a highly motivated student to join our group for a 10-week long summer internship program. A successful candidate will work with their mentor to adopt, develop, and apply multi-omics integration methods to assess novel molecular determinants of drug sensitivity. In particular, the goal will be to evaluate and build upon data integration methods such as contrastive principal component analysis (Abid, Nat Commun 2018) and DeepDEP (Chiu, Sci Adv 2021) to develop transferable predictive models that take routine omics measurements such as gene expression or genetic variation for the prediction of cell-intrinsic properties (gene dependencies or metastatic potential) as well as pharmacological profiles including compound sensitivities. Training of these models will be performed mainly on in vitro models and should be generalizable to more complex systems (e.g., organoids and primary tumors) based on recent work estimating gene essentially in primary tumors using TCGA-CCLE aligned transcriptomes (Shi, bioRxiv 2022). Critical to this procedure will be the biologically informed exclusion of signals arising from known discrepancies between systems such as stromal and immune components separating in vivo and in vitro contexts. The proposed work will finally leverage in-house molecular profiles to facilitate rapid in silico discovery of novel combinatorial drivers underlying disease progression and treatment response, ultimately having the potential to broadly accelerate diverse R&D efforts. Throughout this process, the candidate will have the opportunity to learn from experienced computational biologists, exercise their skills in bioinformatics, and learn about the process of R&D in an industry setting.Key Responsibilities Research and benchmark supervised/unsupervised data integration methods as applied to gene expression and other modalities from public resourcesOrganize and compile a database of internal and external omics datasets to enable large-scale data mining effortsLeverage integrated omics profiles to translate and generalize experimental findings across cancer models (e.g., cell lines, xenografts, tumors)Develop effective means of visualization (e.g., in the form of dashboards) to summarize and communicate dataset characteristics and predictive model outputsQualifications & Experience Experience in programming with Python or R as well as common statistical frameworks in the corresponding language (e.g., scikit-learn, tidymodels)Working knowledge of statistical modelling or machine learning is strongly preferredFamiliarity with different omics modalities is a plusExperience with data visualization in both static (e.g., ggplot2, matplotlib/seaborn) and interactive (e.g., Plotly, Bokeh, D3) formatsCurrently enrolled in a MS/PhD program in computer science, bioinformatics, statistics, physics, or a similar fieldMust be able to work full-time for the program durationExcellent verbal and communication skills Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues. Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.Physical presence at the BMS worksite or physical presence in the field is an essential job function of this role which the Company deems critical to collaboration, innovation, productivity, employee well-being and engagement, and enhances the Company culture. To protect the safety of our workforce, customers, patients and communities, the policy of the Company requires all employees and workers in the U.S. and Puerto Rico to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless they have received an exception based on an approved request for a medical or religious reasonable accommodation.Therefore, all BMS applicants seeking a role located in the U.S. and Puerto Rico must confirm that they have already received or are willing to receive the full COVID-19 vaccination by their start date as a qualification of the role and condition of employment.This requirement is subject to state and local law restrictions and may not be applicable to employees working in certain jurisdictions such as Montana. This requirement is also subject to discussions with collective bargaining representatives in the U.S. Our company is committed to ensuring that people with disabilities can excel through a transparent recruitment process, reasonable workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Applicants can request an approval of accommodation prior to accepting a job offer. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application or if you are applying to a role based in the U.S. or Puerto Rico and you believe that you are unable to receive a COVID-19 vaccine due to a medical condition or sincerely held religious belief, during or any part of the recruitment process, please direct your inquiries to adastaffingsupport@bms.com. Visitcareers.bms.com/eeo-accessibilityto access our complete Equal Employment Opportunity statement. BMS will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, pursuant to applicable laws in your area. Any data processed in connection with role applications will be treated in accordance with applicable data privacy policies and regulations.Show moreShow less

Are you a Junior Data Modeler who is loves all things data, loves a challenge, and is looking for a dynamic and highly rewarding position with our nationally respected client?Serving as a Junior Data Modeler, you will be responsible for partnering with clients to analyze and translate business needs into long-term solution data models and evaluate existing data systems, translations, and structures for optimization.. You will also be responsible for working with data modeling tools to design data structures that meet organizational needs using conceptual, logical, and physical data models and partner with solution team to create conceptual data models and data flows.This is a 100 % remote full-time, permanent opportunity that is Ohio, with competitive compensation, while offering health/dental/vision benefits, life/disability benefits, paid holidays, paid sick and parental leave, paid vacation, and tuition reimbursement—and many other extra benefits. Our client is committed to a culture of health and wellness programs with onsite recreational and sports centers. Person is required to live in Ohio, Indiana, or Kentucky or to relocate to one of those states. This client has has a recent (repeat) selection as a Top 100 Best Place to Work in IT.Requirements· Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Analytics, or related field· 2+ years of data modeling experience· 1+ year of Erwin Data Modeler experience or similar· Knowledge of the importance of following FERPA, HIPAA, diversity principles, data integrity, and other compliance program policies and how to apply them to data security practices· Experience/understanding of Agile development including Scrum or KanbanIf you are seeking an opportunity to advance your career as a Junior Data Modeler with an innovative, growing, award-winning institution, please apply for immediate consideration.Show moreShow less

Intern – Data, Analytics, and Insights - Summer 2023CAS uses unparalleled scientific content, specialized technology and unmatched human expertise to help R&D organizations across Commercial, Government and Academic sectors create groundbreaking innovations that benefit the world. As the Scientific Information Solutions Division of the American Chemical Society, CAS manages the largest curated reservoir of scientific knowledge, and for 114 years, has helped innovators mine, assess and apply that information to keep businesses thriving. The CAS team is global, diverse, endlessly curious and strives to make actionable scientific insights accessible to innovators worldwide.CAS is currently seeking an Intern for the Summer of 2023 to work in its Data, Analytics and Insights (DAI) division. This position will be located in our headquarters in Columbus, Ohio.DAI interns are passionate about data and applying analytical methods while simultaneously understanding the business context in order to arrive at a solution. Over the course of the internship the intern will work their way through our methodology (Business Understanding, Data Understanding, Data Preparation, Modeling, and Evaluation), leverage vast quantities of data, and build an accurate mathematical model.Duties Develop, plan, and execute an analytical project as an individual contributor Synthesize analytical findings for consumption by senior business executives Organize data from many different types of sources and at significantly varying scales for subsequent analysis Critically evaluate data for quality measures such as completeness, accuracy, and applicability, applying understanding of relevant research area nomenclature Solve an unusual problem using a combination of appropriate statistics, machine learning, and computational methods Create a consulting-quality, final presentation and poster describing results with visualizations in a manner that CAS employees at-large can understand Perform other duties as assignedQualifications Must be at least senior in standing starting with the fall semester of 2023 Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, or Industrial Engineering Experience with Python or R, and SQL Demonstrated analytical, multi-tasking, problem solving, organizational, and planning skills Ability to interpret reports, analyze trends, and provide insights Experience with Tableau or other visualization software a plus Strong written and verbal communication skills. Demonstrated ability to communicate complicated statistical analytical concepts to business stakeholders in a simplified, comprehendible manner.Candidates for this position must be authorized to work in the United States and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future. EEO/Minority/Female/Disabled/VeteranShow moreShow less

Job Title: Data Analyst, Data Analytics  What Data & Analytics Management contributes to Cardinal Health  The Data & Analytics function oversees the analytics solution lifecycle to identify, analyze and present relevant insights that drive business decisions and anticipate opportunities to achieve a competitive advantage. This function manages analytic data platforms, the access, design and implementation of reporting/business intelligence solutions, and the application of advanced quantitative modeling. Data Analytics applies business process knowledge and data analytics to develop, recommend and communicate timely, accurate, relevant, and actionable insights to support business decisions and objectives.  What Global Sourcing Business Analytics contributes to Cardinal Health  Our Mission is to transform the Strategic Sourcing & Manufacturer Services organization. This organization is a supporting pillar of our Pharmaceutical Distribution business. We support several business units including Strategic Sourcing, Regulatory Science/I&E, Specialty GPO, 3PL, and Patient-Hub business services.  WHY: We exist to create value for our customers, accelerate strategic initiatives, return profits to our business, and execute best-in-class support for our stakeholders.  HOW: We differentiate our performance in the way we prioritize and by being embedded in the organization we support. Our priorities are financial growth, partnership, speed, simplicity, and long-term business continuity.  WHAT: We leverage our expertise in the Healthcare Industry, Technology and Management Consulting to build Data & Analytics and Automation solutions that better decision making and drive financial growth.  Stakeholder Responsibilities Develop analytics solutions that create business value, augment decision making and save time for users. Partner with Stakeholders by providing end-to-end analytics and management consultant support to strategic initiatives. Lead Stakeholders to new business opportunities by leveraging internal and external market and operational insights. Become both a technical and business SME of the supported business units. Support stakeholder relationships balancing business stability with prioritization of highest value initiatives. Build and execute a Stakeholder Analytics Development Roadmap for the supported business units. Represent Strategic Sourcing & Manufacturer Services in cross-functional digital and analytics initiatives. Validate reporting and data accuracy with technology partners and business stakeholders. Monitor and evaluate product progress at each stage of the process and be able to articulate progress, accomplishments, and challenges in various stakeholder meetings. Utilize SQL/Alteryx/Python/R or other relevant statistical tools for data mining, data profiling, and predictive analytics, and leverage Tableau for Data Visualization.  Team Responsibilities Contribute to the growth strategy for the Strategy Analytics Services pillar. Support Cardinal Health’s DE&I strategy for attracting and retaining talent. Participate in professional development activities such as Digital U, formal mentorships, and other development programs. Maintain data governance and product ownership development standards. This includes writing effective documentation and participating in solution certification reviews. Support internal team development committees.  Preferred Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in related field, or equivalent work experience. 3+ years of net experience in a related field. Subject-matter expertise in self-service analytics tools (Alteryx, SQL), data visualization tools (Tableau), Cloud Platforms (GCP, AWS, Azure), and Scripting Languages (Python, R). Ability to communicate effectively and interact with personnel at all levels of technical ability and expertise. Experience developing creative and innovative analytical insights with high business value. Attention to detail and business acumen, with the ability to solve complex problems in a fast-paced environment. Experience developing presentations and presenting to senior management.   What are Cardinal Health’s Values? Integrity: We hold ourselves to the highest ethical standards. Inclusive: We embrace differences to drive the best outcomes. Innovative: We develop new ways of thinking, operating, and serving customers. Accountable: We bring passion, determination, and grit to deliver on our commitments. Mission driven: We serve the greater goal of healthcare. Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, veteran status, marital status, creed, status with regard to public assistance, genetic status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.Show moreShow less

Your first step towards an amazing career in Research and Development (R&D) at Procter and Gamble (P&G) starts with applying to this internship. Within an R&D internship, you’ll be actively involved in creating, reimagining and launching new innovations which improve our consumers lives… all around the world.As a company, P&G believes that ‘innovation is our lifeblood’. As such, we invest to ensure that our products best serve the current and future needs of our more than 5 billion consumers worldwide across our 65 iconic, trusted brands.From Day 1, you’ll be equipped with cutting edge innovation tools, you’ll be encouraged to dive into the innovation process, and you’ll be tasked to advance real needs for our business. To enable your success, you’ll collaborate with talented technologists and mentors to strengthen your skillsets and develop new areas of mastery. The environments you’ll work in are creative workspaces where new ideas flourish and where your technical mastery is recognized and rewarded. Ultimately, our investment in you is equally an investment in the development of our future R&D talent and in advancing our lofty innovation goals.What will I do?Our Associate Scientist Interns are constantly learning, growing in service of improving how our products perform. In this role, you will find new ways to innovate, develop and manufacture consumer products. Since we’re a highly collaborative company, you will have the opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest technical and commercial partners.We strive to match your skills, qualifications, and interests with a role that works best for you and have a number of areas in R&D where you could work as an intern, including:Products Research: Deeply understand our consumers and their needs in order to inform product design parameters for new or improved products.Product Formulation & Design: Translates the consumer’s needs into the development of delightful finished-products which use the best available technologies/chemicals/materials.Packaging & Device Development: Creates and improves packages and devices that delight consumers and retailers. Packaging and Device technologists lead the development of packages of superior function and premium design. In addition to ensuring the product functions well once the consumer has brought it home, we place a premium in ensuring that our packages and devices are responsibly developed with sustainability in mind. Process Development & Pilot Plant Operations: Translates ideas, concepts, and technologies into the design and scale-up of commercially feasible, state of the art, chemical and mechanical manufacturing processes.Material Development: Start by developing 'new to the world' raw material technologies so we can meet our customer's needs with the highest quality, best performing materials.Modeling and Simulation (M&S): M&S development is a powerful capability which increasingly underpins the work across all our R&D functions. Our M&S experts are developing new to the world mathematical models which speed the pace and impact of our innovations.Data Science: Here, we would want you to communicate complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to drive action based on the insights you derive. As a Data Scientist, you will transform the business to enable better decision-making through the use of advanced analytics.QualificationsWe are looking for Bachelor's/Master's students who: Majoring in engineering degrees:We offer a wide range of roles for Chemical, Mechanical and Biomedical Engineering. About AMEND:AMEND is a management consulting firm based in Cincinnati, OH with areas of focus in operations, analytics, and technology, focused on strengthening the people, processes, and systems in organizations to generate a holistic transformation. Our three-tiered approach provides a distinct competitive edge and allows us to build strong relationships and create customized solutions for every client. We work each day to change lives and transform businesses, and we are constantly striving to make a positive impact on our community! The AMEND team continues to grow at a rapid pace, and we believe that our Analyst team will continue to be an important part of that journey.Overview:This is a 16-week development program for students and early professionals, designed to accelerate your career either through a rotational internship or a start to your full-time career at AMEND. You will work directly with Partners, Project Leaders, and business executives to accomplish project goals and deliver solutions for your clients. This is a client-facing role, solving real problems and engaging with business strategy while designing cutting-edge solutions with your technical skills. While taking on the role of a fully billable consultant in this rigorous program, you will participate in weekly trainings to learn about all areas of focus at AMEND, develop an individualized development plan for yourself, and experience mentorship from experts in our field. Do you want to take ownership of your career then this position is for you? Our client is looking for an IT Security Analyst to play a vital role in keeping the firm’s proprietary and sensitive information secure. He/she works inter-departmentally to identify and correct flaws in the firm’s security systems, solutions, and programs while recommending specific measures that can improve the firm’s overall security posture. You will be responsible for ensuring that the firm’s digital assets are protected from unauthorized access. This includes securing both online and on premise infrastructures, weeding through metrics and data to filter out suspicious activity, and finding and mitigating risks before breaches occur. If a breach does occur, the security analyst will be on the front line, leading efforts to counter the attack. You will have an associates or BA/BS ideally in Computer Science, Cyber Security, Information Security, Engineering, or Information Technology, and a minimum of 2 years of IT-related experience. Previous experience working in a law firm or service industry is preferred. Must possess strong customer service skills along with the ability to diagnose and solve complex software and hardware issues. Help Desk Ticketing systems are a must. Must have industry-recognized certifications in CISSP, GIAC, or similar (or achieve within one year of employment).Show moreShow less

job title: Bristol Myers Squibb, Intern, Computational Biology (Summer 2023) - Application via WayUp
job description: This role is with Bristol Myers Squibb. WayUp is partnering with Bristol Myers Squibb to hire top talent.At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.Position SummaryWe are seeking a highly motivated student to join our group for a 10-week long summer internship program. A successful candidate will work with their mentor to adopt, develop, and apply multi-omics integration methods to assess novel molecular determinants of drug sensitivity. In particular, the goal will be to evaluate and build upon data integration methods such as contrastive principal component analysis (Abid, Nat Commun 2018) and DeepDEP (Chiu, Sci Adv 2021) to develop transferable predictive models that take routine omics measurements such as gene expression or genetic variation for the prediction of cell-intrinsic properties (gene dependencies or metastatic potential) as well as pharmacological profiles including compound sensitivities. Training of these models will be performed mainly on in vitro models and should be generalizable to more complex systems (e.g., organoids and primary tumors) based on recent work estimating gene essentially in primary tumors using TCGA-CCLE aligned transcriptomes (Shi, bioRxiv 2022). Critical to this procedure will be the biologically informed exclusion of signals arising from known discrepancies between systems such as stromal and immune components separating in vivo and in vitro contexts. The proposed work will finally leverage in-house molecular profiles to facilitate rapid in silico discovery of novel combinatorial drivers underlying disease progression and treatment response, ultimately having the potential to broadly accelerate diverse R&D efforts. Throughout this process, the candidate will have the opportunity to learn from experienced computational biologists, exercise their skills in bioinformatics, and learn about the process of R&D in an industry setting.Key Responsibilities Research and benchmark supervised/unsupervised data integration methods as applied to gene expression and other modalities from public resourcesOrganize and compile a database of internal and external omics datasets to enable large-scale data mining effortsLeverage integrated omics profiles to translate and generalize experimental findings across cancer models (e.g., cell lines, xenografts, tumors)Develop effective means of visualization (e.g., in the form of dashboards) to summarize and communicate dataset characteristics and predictive model outputsQualifications & Experience Experience in programming with Python or R as well as common statistical frameworks in the corresponding language (e.g., scikit-learn, tidymodels)Working knowledge of statistical modelling or machine learning is strongly preferredFamiliarity with different omics modalities is a plusExperience with data visualization in both static (e.g., ggplot2, matplotlib/seaborn) and interactive (e.g., Plotly, Bokeh, D3) formatsCurrently enrolled in a MS/PhD program in computer science, bioinformatics, statistics, physics, or a similar fieldMust be able to work full-time for the program durationExcellent verbal and communication skills Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues. Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.Physical presence at the BMS worksite or physical presence in the field is an essential job function of this role which the Company deems critical to collaboration, innovation, productivity, employee well-being and engagement, and enhances the Company culture. To protect the safety of our workforce, customers, patients and communities, the policy of the Company requires all employees and workers in the U.S. and Puerto Rico to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless they have received an exception based on an approved request for a medical or religious reasonable accommodation.Therefore, all BMS applicants seeking a role located in the U.S. and Puerto Rico must confirm that they have already received or are willing to receive the full COVID-19 vaccination by their start date as a qualification of the role and condition of employment.This requirement is subject to state and local law restrictions and may not be applicable to employees working in certain jurisdictions such as Montana. This requirement is also subject to discussions with collective bargaining representatives in the U.S. Our company is committed to ensuring that people with disabilities can excel through a transparent recruitment process, reasonable workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Applicants can request an approval of accommodation prior to accepting a job offer. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application or if you are applying to a role based in the U.S. or Puerto Rico and you believe that you are unable to receive a COVID-19 vaccine due to a medical condition or sincerely held religious belief, during or any part of the recruitment process, please direct your inquiries to adastaffingsupport@bms.com. Visitcareers.bms.com/eeo-accessibilityto access our complete Equal Employment Opportunity statement. job title: Bristol Myers Squibb, Intern, Bioinformatics (Summer 2023) - Application via WayUp
job description: This role is with Bristol Myers Squibb. WayUp is partnering with Bristol Myers Squibb to hire top talent.At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.Position SummaryWe are seeking a highly motivated student to join our group for a 10-week long summer internship program. A successful candidate will work with their mentor to create an ensemble of machine learning approaches to accurately identify short tandem repeats (STR) in the genome of patients. STRs have a recognized role in several phenotypes including amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), Huntington’s disease, myotonic dystrophies, etc. Multiple computational approaches exist that report the presence of pre-determined STRs in specific genomic loci. However, these computational approaches do not reach a perfect consensus of the set of the reported STRs on the same Next Generation Sequencing and Genome Wide Sequencing data. To fill this gap, the candidate will leverage published scientific literature to generate a set of well supported STRs and implement predictive approaches to construct an ensemble for detecting STRs. Further, the candidate will also explore the validity of the approach with business relevant cohorts. The candidate will have the opportunity to work with an interdisciplinary team of experienced bioinformaticians, collaborate with biologists and learn about the complexity of drug target discovery.Key Responsibilities Participate in designing a set of verified ground truth from published scientific literature that will assist in the construction of predictive approaches for detecting genomic expansionsExplore a range of features that could be useful in detecting correct genomic expansions reported by multiple computational toolsConstruct an ensemble of predictive algorithms to detect genomic expansions with higher confidenceBuild disease specific and patient specific set of STRsProvide written documentation and specifications for developed methods and workflowsExpect to present to large audience at the completion of the internshipQualifications & Experience Currently enrolled in a graduate program in computer science, statistics, bioinformatics, life sciences or a similar fieldFluency with Linux, docker and AWS cloud computingExperience with machine learning packages like scikit-learnExperience with benchmarking predictive computational methods; familiarity with evaluation metricsGood programming skills using scripting languages (e.g., Python, R/Bioconductor) and notebooks (e.g. R markdown, Jupyter notebook)Experience with analyzing WGS data to explore genomic expansions is a plusExcellent verbal and communication skillsMust be able to work full-time for the program duration Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.
