job title: Bristol Myers Squibb, Intern, Computational Biology (Summer 2023) - Application via WayUp
job description: This role is with Bristol Myers Squibb. WayUp is partnering with Bristol Myers Squibb to hire top talent.At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.Position SummaryWe are seeking a highly motivated student to join our group for a 10-week long summer internship program. A successful candidate will work with their mentor to adopt, develop, and apply multi-omics integration methods to assess novel molecular determinants of drug sensitivity. In particular, the goal will be to evaluate and build upon data integration methods such as contrastive principal component analysis (Abid, Nat Commun 2018) and DeepDEP (Chiu, Sci Adv 2021) to develop transferable predictive models that take routine omics measurements such as gene expression or genetic variation for the prediction of cell-intrinsic properties (gene dependencies or metastatic potential) as well as pharmacological profiles including compound sensitivities. Training of these models will be performed mainly on in vitro models and should be generalizable to more complex systems (e.g., organoids and primary tumors) based on recent work estimating gene essentially in primary tumors using TCGA-CCLE aligned transcriptomes (Shi, bioRxiv 2022). Critical to this procedure will be the biologically informed exclusion of signals arising from known discrepancies between systems such as stromal and immune components separating in vivo and in vitro contexts. The proposed work will finally leverage in-house molecular profiles to facilitate rapid in silico discovery of novel combinatorial drivers underlying disease progression and treatment response, ultimately having the potential to broadly accelerate diverse R&D efforts. Throughout this process, the candidate will have the opportunity to learn from experienced computational biologists, exercise their skills in bioinformatics, and learn about the process of R&D in an industry setting.Key Responsibilities Research and benchmark supervised/unsupervised data integration methods as applied to gene expression and other modalities from public resourcesOrganize and compile a database of internal and external omics datasets to enable large-scale data mining effortsLeverage integrated omics profiles to translate and generalize experimental findings across cancer models (e.g., cell lines, xenografts, tumors)Develop effective means of visualization (e.g., in the form of dashboards) to summarize and communicate dataset characteristics and predictive model outputsQualifications & Experience Experience in programming with Python or R as well as common statistical frameworks in the corresponding language (e.g., scikit-learn, tidymodels)Working knowledge of statistical modelling or machine learning is strongly preferredFamiliarity with different omics modalities is a plusExperience with data visualization in both static (e.g., ggplot2, matplotlib/seaborn) and interactive (e.g., Plotly, Bokeh, D3) formatsCurrently enrolled in a MS/PhD program in computer science, bioinformatics, statistics, physics, or a similar fieldMust be able to work full-time for the program durationExcellent verbal and communication skills Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues. Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.Physical presence at the BMS worksite or physical presence in the field is an essential job function of this role which the Company deems critical to collaboration, innovation, productivity, employee well-being and engagement, and enhances the Company culture. To protect the safety of our workforce, customers, patients and communities, the policy of the Company requires all employees and workers in the U.S. and Puerto Rico to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless they have received an exception based on an approved request for a medical or religious reasonable accommodation.Therefore, all BMS applicants seeking a role located in the U.S. and Puerto Rico must confirm that they have already received or are willing to receive the full COVID-19 vaccination by their start date as a qualification of the role and condition of employment.This requirement is subject to state and local law restrictions and may not be applicable to employees working in certain jurisdictions such as Montana. This requirement is also subject to discussions with collective bargaining representatives in the U.S. Our company is committed to ensuring that people with disabilities can excel through a transparent recruitment process, reasonable workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Applicants can request an approval of accommodation prior to accepting a job offer. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application or if you are applying to a role based in the U.S. or Puerto Rico and you believe that you are unable to receive a COVID-19 vaccine due to a medical condition or sincerely held religious belief, during or any part of the recruitment process, please direct your inquiries to adastaffingsupport@bms.com. Visitcareers.bms.com/eeo-accessibilityto access our complete Equal Employment Opportunity statement. BMS will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, pursuant to applicable laws in your area. DescriptionData Analytics EngineerLocation: Marysville, OH / ADCWhat Makes a Honda, Is Who Makes a HondaHonda has a clear vision for the future, and it’s a joyful one. We strive to be a company which serves as a source of “power” that supports people around the world who are trying to do things based on their own initiative and that helps people expand their own potential. To this end, Honda strives to realize “the joy and freedom of mobility” by developing new technologies and an innovative approach to achieve a “zero environmental footprint.”We are looking for qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds, experiences, continuous improvement values, and a strong work ethic to join our team.If your goals and values align with Honda’s, we want you to join our team to Bring the Future!About This PositionThis role revolves around identifying, planning, and implementing system improvements and applying analytics from proof-of-concept to production. The Data Analytics Engineer generates new ideas to derive value from data and assists in project scoping, design, data analysis, and execution.Responsibilities Include Translating business inquiries and challenges into data-driven solutions with the support of data engineers, scientists, and IT (defining scope & requirements) Building and implementing models and dashboards for use by all levels of the organization Developing processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and dataaccuracy Presenting results to senior management as required. Identifying business challenges and translate into SMART requirements for AGILE development Launching projects consistently in an AGILE methodology and report benefits Mentoring associates in analytics tools and projectsWho We Are SeekingRequired Work Experience:2 - 6 years of experience based upon education (2 years analytics/project lead experience)Required EducationBachelors’ degree in Engineering, Data Analytics, Data Science, MIS, Computer Science; or equivalent relevant experience.Desired SkillsExperience with open-source data analytics in Python and/or R (data mining, data modelling, machine learning) and data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, Plotly, etc).Comprehension of inferential statistics, machine learning, and applied data analytics.Linear programming for optimization.Additional Position FactorsWorkstyle: Office/ Fast-pace Manufacturing environmentTravel: 15%At Honda, you will play a key role in our journey to become a company that society wants to exist now, and in the future. Your endless curiosity will drive innovation and your courageous spirit will challenge the status quo. We believe having a workforce made up of diverse thinkers and innovators makes us a better Honda. Respect for each other and respect for diversity each and every day drives our associates to contribute at the highest level and work effectively in a team environment. We make the dream of mobility a reality with our innovative and high-quality products. Together, we Bring the Future to our customers, associates, and communities. We are Honda!What differentiates Honda and make us an employer of choice?Total RewardsCompetitive base salary Annual BonusOvertime PayIndustry leading Benefit Plans (Medical, Dental, Vision)Paid time off, including vacation, paid holidays, sick time, personal days401K Plan with company match + additional contributionRelocation assistance (if eligible)Career GrowthAdvancement opportunitiesCareer mobility Education reimbursement for continued learningTraining and Development programs Additional OfferingsWellbeing programCommunity service and engagement programsProduct programsFree drinks onsiteHonda is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected factor.Honda Development and Manufacturing of America, LLC.Show moreShow less

Red Arch Solutions is looking for a motivated Chief Software Engineer to join us working on a contract for the National Air and Space Intelligence Center (NASIC). This position would work in collaboration with researchers to develop, sustain, and utilize tools for military intelligence, including measurement and signatures intelligence (MASINT) and geospatial intelligence (GEOINT). Successful candidates will perform software sustainment & development tasks and must be able to work in a collaborative environment with the customer and other teammates to define requirements and manage projects.Work location will primarily be on-site at the NASIC facilities. Experience with using and developing methods for exploitation of signals/imagery is a plus.Description:Applies and develops highly advanced technical technologies, scientific principles, theories and concepts. Contractor spokesperson on technical capabilities and future directions.Designs the research for and the development of highly advanced new technological applications.Possesses sufficient writing and communication skills to prepare and present reports, papers, proposals, briefings and other documentation pertinent to the position.Leads technical personnel and activities for large programs or groups of programs.Develop algorithm storage and processing capabilities according to the list below: Develop streaming Algorithms capabilityDevelop a community collaboration element Facilitate advanced triggers Enable batch API processing of data through jobs Improve Job Monitoring Improve Versioning support Support the implementation of new and updated enterprise patterns affecting algorithms Provide enhanced metrics and reporting Provide idempotent APIs for managing user contributions Develop advanced features in Formulas Algorithm Maturation and Transition: evaluate current algorithms and recommend a prioritized list for optimization, automation, and transitionThe algorithm’s current and desired future maturity based upon the algorithm maturity model The recommended approach to incorporate monitoring and logging, optimization, and automation within the algorithm The current location of the algorithm, the intended final destination of the algorithm, and operational dependencies between algorithms’ I/O. The language(s), libraries, frameworks, and any other dependencies required by the algorithm (to include version(s) used). The current algorithm performance, mission performance requirements for the algorithm, and the estimated complexity for making up the difference.The test data and expected results for the algorithm from this test data The required testing to be performed in order to validate the correct operation of the rewritten algorithm with confirmation from users and/or researchers that the validation procedures are acceptable The activities that were required in order to achieve successful development, testing, and validation, as well as the activities required to achieve desired future maturity Qualifications:At a minimum, Master’s degree in engineering, science, or mathematics with 15 years engineering experience.Applications and Tools desired:Possesses Package Software Expertise in SSIS ETL and reporting tools and algorithm development experience in PERL and PL/SQL. Deep understanding of the Data Warehousing SDLC and architecture of ETL, reporting and BI tools, Argo Workflows, Argo EventsOther:- Postgres- MinIO (or other Object Storage)- Harbor (or other Docker registry)- Kafka- ElasticSearch- Prometheus- KeyCloak- ULM- ArgoCD- Istio ingress/egress*Active TS/SCI is required for this position*Show moreShow less

We’re currently assisting our customer with a Direct Hire search for an RPA Digital Analyst to help them reverse engineer their existing product verticals, recommend more efficient process management, and process mine for automation (RPA). This individual should have experience working, supporting, and analyzing front, middle, and back-office systems. The ideal candidate has experience with financial systems and RPA Automation. In addition, the candidate must possess critical thinking skills and the ability to identify and solve complex problems at pace.Duties and Responsibilities:· Data Analysis & RPA Process Mining · Recommend and document new or enhanced business rules logic · Research potential new vendor systems · Work directly with internal partners, business units, and leadership to distill technical requirements into high-quality documentation that is easily understood by the development team · Manipulation of raw data into consumable format· Distribute documentation in a standardized, repeatable format to the appropriate audience (e.g., executive summaries for leadership, technical acceptance criteria for developers, etc.)· Manage daily communication between partners, vendors, and developers to ensure forward progress toward a given deadline· Other duties as assigned Required Experience· 2+ years working in business analysis within the financial industry.· 2+ RPA experience · 2+ years managing daily communication between partners, vendors, and developers to ensure forward progress towards a given deadline. · Experience in Data, System and Processes Mapping · Experience creating and managing a complex product plan in an efficient and timely manner. Preferred Experience· Working knowledge of financial Products· Lean Processes Improvement background· Scripting· Understanding of Agile and Waterfall workflow methodology· Experience with Cognos and Report building · Database Queries · Experience with collaboration tools such as: Smartsheets, Jira, Confluence, and MiroShow moreShow less

DescriptionReinforcement Learning ResearcherSTR’s Analytics Division is seeking a reinforcement learning researcher to join our team of scientists and engineers, who develop and apply cutting edge reinforcement learning approaches for many problems, including swarm/drone deployment, fighter-jet dogfighting and tactical wargaming. Our projects integrate algorithmic research and software engineering to address challenging national security problems. We actively collaborate with research engineers across STR, as well as with academic researchers and industry partners to develop practical and powerful solutions to applying autonomy in the real world.Our ideal candidate possesses knowledge of the state-of-the-art in reinforcement learning (RL), understands how to implement RL algorithms in software, and is only satisfied when their innovations become a reality by integrating them into real autonomous systems. Because we have a highly-collaborative, multi-disciplinary team, our perfect candidate also has a strong desire to learn about new, interesting problem domains to identify where RL would have the greatest impact. We prioritize collaboration and team culture in addition to being results-oriented, and therefore we always seek researchers and scientists with excellent written and verbal communication skills.The RoleApply and improve cutting-edge academic research in RL to defense-domain problems (wargames, flight, naval) to train autonomous agents that surpass the performance of existing algorithmsBuild large-scale, real-world autonomous systems by collaborating with STR’s world-class team of engineers and researchers in the machine learning community, our academic partners and our customersAnalyze data and agent behavior by both replaying simulated scenarios as well as examining real-world data to identify performance improvement strategiesInteract with national security customers and users to determine and assess unmet needs and evolving requirementsTransition algorithms to prototype and/or real-time systems demonstrationsPosition may involve travel to customer meetings and/or data collections and experimentsWho You AreBS, MS or PhD degree in Computer Science.Academic and/or industry experience training agents to optimize criterion in simulated environmentsExperience with scientific software development and algorithm implementationProficient in Python, Docker, PyTorch, TensorFlowMotivated collaborator with internal and external teamsSome Other Relevant Skills You May HavePublished work in academic conferences Experience with cloud computing (AWS, GCloud, Azure) Experience with RLlib, Unity Familiar with Agile Development Workflow STR is a rapidly growing technology company with locations north of Boston, MA, Arlington, VA and near Dayton, OH. We specialize in advanced research and development for defense, intelligence, and national security, trying to understand how to protect our society: from stopping malicious botnet attacks, to understanding cyber vulnerabilities, providing next generation sensors, radar, sonar, communications, and electronic warfare to developing artificial intelligence algorithms and analytics to make sense of the complexity that is exploding around us. Visit us at www.str.us for more info.STR is committed to creating a collaborative learning environment that supports deep technical understanding and recognizes the contributions and achievements of all team members. Our work is challenging, but you go home at night knowing that you pushed the forefront of technology and made the world a little safer. We recognize that the world is changing, that it is becoming more connected than ever before, making things change faster than before, and reshaping society in the process. We all want to understand this changing world and leave it better for our work.STR is an equal opportunity employer. We are fully dedicated to hiring the most qualified candidate regardless of race, color, religion, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation and pregnancy), marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.If you need a reasonable accommodation for any portion of the employment process, email us at appassist@str.us and provide your contact info.Pursuant to applicable federal law and regulations, positions at STR require employees to obtain national security clearances and satisfy the requirements for compliance with export control and other applicable laws.Show moreShow less

Bid Number:22-016Bid Title:DATA & ANALYTICS CONSULTANTBid Description:STATEMENT OF WORKCOTA is looking for consultant who can temporarily fill the role of Sr. Director of Data and Analytics at COTA while we search for a full-time replacement. The role of data and analytics has quickly become an important part of the COTA culture and it is important that we continue the momentum while advising on implementation and adjustments to our strategy.Responsibilities" Continues development and implementation of COTA's data and analytics strategy based on the Strategic Plan for Authority-wide projects and initiatives;" Understands existing reporting and analytics processes/best practices and identifies innovative strategies for enhancements" Advises COTA leadership on data capabilities in support of various projects, initiatives, dashboard capabilities and reports;" Collaborates with COTA leadership to define data requirements for new business initiatives particularly in the areas of BI, analytics, and data warehousing;" Serves as a liaison with external data providers;" Provides oversight to advance projects and initiatives; and" Ability to work across various departments to establish common business definitions and rules on key performance indicators based on the current environment with the ability to build conceptual data models as the organization continues to grow." Analyzing databases to assess accessibility and accuracy and identifying opportunities for new data sources;" Partner with IT on existing data infrastructure and reporting environment for analysis of key information within COTA;" Mentors and guides an existing data and analytics organization of internal and external individuals.Knowledge, Skills & Abilities" Extensive knowledge of business intelligence practices and tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, MicroStrategy);" Experience with Data.World, Alation, Informatica or other type of data cataloging technologies" Experience with SQL, R, SAS, python, SPARQL, JSON or other type of data analytics technologies and languages;" Skills in contract management;" Knowledge of how to build and manage an effective data operation (Agile experience a plus);" Ability to build and scale a data governance program ensuring data is managed properly, according to principles, policies, standards, and procedures, while delivering high quality data;" Understanding of Talend, Alteryx, Informatica, Azure Pipelines, Amazon Glue or other data pipeline technologies" Ability to drive KPI adoption and goal setting;" Understanding of ArcGIS and geo-spatial data is a preferred but optional" Ability to define problems, research issues and develop logical and practical solutions within the framework of general principles of information technology project management and the policies and procedures of the Authority." Experience with technology-driven change management;" Ability to understand technology concepts at a high level, and communicate with technical people;" Skills in verbal and written communication;" Ability to effectively communicate with internal and external resources to resolve potential conflicts and maintain a teamwork atmosphere;" Skills in effective stakeholder management;" Skills in human relations; and" Ability to direct and lead team members and external contractors.CONTRACT PARAMETERS" Start within two weeks of contract signature and available at least 20 hours a week. Hours may increase to 30 hours on certain weeks" Contract will be no less than 12 weeks and no longer than 24 weeks. Preferred start in April 2022." Contract will not be greater than $95,000.Show moreShow less

Looking for an internship that will use your business, data analytics, economics, engineering, information systems, or related degree and get your career off on the right foot? As a 2023 Veritiv Summer Intern, you will get on-the-job training and mentoring and real-world experience in your field. Veritiv employees are well-trained and able to access vast professional resources to develop their careers. It’s a great place to start your career in data analytics.You’ll be paid a competitive wage and put your education into action while learning real, marketable skills with a growing company that is hiring. You’ll participate in team projects, social events, volunteer work and professional development training. This is a full-time (40 hours/week) paid hybrid internship that will begin on June 5, 2023 and conclude on August 4, 2023.Veritiv Corporation is a Fortune 500® company headquartered in Atlanta, GA. The company is a leading North American business-to-business distributor of packaging, facility solutions, print and publishing, and a provider of logistics and supply chain management services.Job Summary And ScopeAs a Data Management Intern, you will assist Veritiv with cross-functional data maintenance and enrichment initiatives. This is accomplished by the reviewing of current gaps or issues with our current master data and developing new innovative solutions. You will work with our Taxonomist and Data Leads to partner with the business and define clear requirements as well as determine statistical benefits for proposed solutions. Your creative thinking will be crucial to ensure our solutions are simple yet viewed as best-in-class.Job ResponsibilitiesIn this role, you willAnalyze requests from internal stakeholders and ensure their requirements/issues are clear and documented properlyCreate reports to support the business cases from internal stakeholders and ensure solutions driven from data and factsCreate scorecards to track progress and health of data management initiativesConducting market research to identify new trends and opportunities to collect new data attributesCollaborate with Digital and Marketing teams to develop an understanding of new initiatives that will enhance the digital customer experienceQualifications/Knowledge & ExperienceA rising junior, senior or recent college graduate pursuing a bachelor’s degree from an accredited four-year college or university in business, data analytics, economics, engineering, information systems, or related degreeAbility to support multiple projects simultaneously, work under pressure, and adapt to sudden changes in the work environmentExcellent skill in Excel or other data processing toolsProficient with Microsoft PowerPointExcellent verbal, written, people, and diplomacy skillsStrong problem-solving and creative thinking skillsVeritiv is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Individuals seeking employment are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, age, disability, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status or any other classification protected by law. Company OverviewOur mission at Forge Biologics, is to enable access to life changing gene therapies and help bring them from idea into reality. We partner with innovators in the gene therapy community: scientists, physicians, biotech and pharma companies and patient groups. We bring expertise in gene therapy manufacturing and development to the table, helping champion teams that are navigating the long road from the lab bench to the patient's bedside. With a patients-first approach, we are forging new models for working together to better accelerate these transformative medicines to reach those who need them the most.Position OverviewForge Biologics is seeking a Policy & Compliance Intern to join our 2023 Ignite Internship Program. In this role, you will have the opportunity to educate and train on Forge’s policies and procedures, uphold compliance for the Forge community and clients, and utilize data to strengthen the effectiveness of compliance strategies. We leverage our business acumen and technical skillsets to help identify and deliver o n initiatives ranging from Adhoc or operational reporting to the development of strategic reporting toolsdriving new revenue streams. WHAT’S IN THIS FOR YOU?Have a hand in building and growing our expanding Analytics teamWork in a supportive, fast paced, entrepreneurial, and innovative wo rkplaceOpportunity to shape development and best practices for our Analytics initiativesGain experience and exposure to BI concepts from visualization to data warehousingGrow business knowledge by working with leadership across all aspects of Medpace’s business Responsibilities WHAT’S INVOLVED? job title: Modeling, Analytics, & Simulation Sciences (MASS) Engineer Intern
job description: The successful candidate will support the Department of Defense in the development of analysis and training models and tools. Typical projects involve building and integrating physics-based models into simulation frameworks, such as AFSIM or ITASE. We also assist in developing scenarios to test new concepts in these simulation environments.The Modeling, Analytics, and Simulation Sciences Operation is heavily focused on support to the Intelligence Community and DoD through specialized software development and M&S tools and infrastructure. We have a unique blend of analysis and modeling capabilities with an understanding of S&TI missions which enables us to provide the Government with innovative solutions to complex software requirements. We are industry leaders in the Air Force Research Lab’s AFSIM modeling and simulation environment and are heavily involved in the Intelligence Community’s TMAP and ITASE MS&A efforts. This opportunity will give the candidate exposure to a wide array of new technologies to include the latest in modeling & simulation, graphic databases, and user interface design. Our dynamic software development teams work collaboratively to develop models of vehicles, sensors, and complex interactions. We utilize analytical tools to aid in understanding test results and solutions and creating graphical representations to relate findings to decision makers.Radiance Technologies is a rapidly growing employee-owned company with benefits unmatched by most companies in the Dayton area. Employee ownership, generous 401K and profit sharing, health/dental/life/vision insurance benefits, educational reimbursements, competitive salaries, pleasant work environments, and stimulating assignments combine to make Radiance Technologies a great place to work and succeed. In fact, Radiance was named by the Dayton Business Journal as one of the Best Places to Work in Dayton the last 4 years, culminating in being named First Place, Best Places to Work in Dayton (Large Business Category) in 2021!Required SkillsCurrently pursuing a degree in Aerospace Engineering, Computer Science, or relevant technical degreeUS citizenship with the ability to obtain a security clearanceExperience with programming languages such as C++ and PythonExperience with Microsoft Office toolsDesired QualificationsSelf-motivated and able to work well within a teamExperience developing physics-based and logical modelsExperience with analytical tools such as JMP and RShow moreShow less

job title: Bristol Myers Squibb, Intern, Computational Biology (Summer 2023) - Application via WayUp
job description: This role is with Bristol Myers Squibb. WayUp is partnering with Bristol Myers Squibb to hire top talent.At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.Position SummaryWe are seeking a highly motivated student to join our group for a 10-week long summer internship program. A successful candidate will work with their mentor to adopt, develop, and apply multi-omics integration methods to assess novel molecular determinants of drug sensitivity. In particular, the goal will be to evaluate and build upon data integration methods such as contrastive principal component analysis (Abid, Nat Commun 2018) and DeepDEP (Chiu, Sci Adv 2021) to develop transferable predictive models that take routine omics measurements such as gene expression or genetic variation for the prediction of cell-intrinsic properties (gene dependencies or metastatic potential) as well as pharmacological profiles including compound sensitivities. Training of these models will be performed mainly on in vitro models and should be generalizable to more complex systems (e.g., organoids and primary tumors) based on recent work estimating gene essentially in primary tumors using TCGA-CCLE aligned transcriptomes (Shi, bioRxiv 2022). Critical to this procedure will be the biologically informed exclusion of signals arising from known discrepancies between systems such as stromal and immune components separating in vivo and in vitro contexts. The proposed work will finally leverage in-house molecular profiles to facilitate rapid in silico discovery of novel combinatorial drivers underlying disease progression and treatment response, ultimately having the potential to broadly accelerate diverse R&D efforts. Throughout this process, the candidate will have the opportunity to learn from experienced computational biologists, exercise their skills in bioinformatics, and learn about the process of R&D in an industry setting.Key Responsibilities Research and benchmark supervised/unsupervised data integration methods as applied to gene expression and other modalities from public resourcesOrganize and compile a database of internal and external omics datasets to enable large-scale data mining effortsLeverage integrated omics profiles to translate and generalize experimental findings across cancer models (e.g., cell lines, xenografts, tumors)Develop effective means of visualization (e.g., in the form of dashboards) to summarize and communicate dataset characteristics and predictive model outputsQualifications & Experience Experience in programming with Python or R as well as common statistical frameworks in the corresponding language (e.g., scikit-learn, tidymodels)Working knowledge of statistical modelling or machine learning is strongly preferredFamiliarity with different omics modalities is a plusExperience with data visualization in both static (e.g., ggplot2, matplotlib/seaborn) and interactive (e.g., Plotly, Bokeh, D3) formatsCurrently enrolled in a MS/PhD program in computer science, bioinformatics, statistics, physics, or a similar fieldMust be able to work full-time for the program durationExcellent verbal and communication skills Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues. Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.Physical presence at the BMS worksite or physical presence in the field is an essential job function of this role which the Company deems critical to collaboration, innovation, productivity, employee well-being and engagement, and enhances the Company culture. Title: Senior Business Intelligence AnalystStatus: ExemptReports to: Director of Data Engineering Job Summary and MissionDivisions Maintenance Group is revolutionizing the facilities maintenance Industry. Our customers include nationwide retailers, warehouses, and multifamily units, relying on DMG’s integrated services to provide quality services inside and outside their facilities – end to end. At DMG, we work AS ONE. We work AS ONE for our Customers, Technicians, and for each other. We produce Uninterrupted Peace of Mind through sustainable partnerships and inspired team members.If data is in your blood, then we have the job to get your heart pumping! We have an opportunity for a Data & Analytics Visualization Engineer. In this role, you would see the interactions in our product and enterprise systems while understanding the role that data and intelligence play in dramatically improving the user cases for the subject matter systems. You would have an immediate impact on helping to accelerate our engineering processes, improve technical readiness of initiatives, and enhance product and service execution in our customer sites and provider network. MTSI is a 100% employee owned by more than 1,300 engineers, analysts, and professionals dedicated to providing high caliber services to aerospace and defense and intelligence customers across the US. We are always looking for the best to join us as we grow.Our first core value is that employees come first. We challenge our co-workers to provide the highest level of support and service, and reward them with some of the best benefits in the industry. Eligible new co-workers start accruing PTO at a rate of 20 days/year, 10 holidays/year, 6% 401k match with immediate vesting, semi-annual bonuses, and eligibility to participate in our company funded Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP). We offer other employee focused benefits, including up to $10k in annual tuition reimbursement and an optional zero dollar deductible BCBS health insurance plan.For additional company information, please visit: http://www.mtsi-va.com/MTSI is seeking a full a mid-level data scientist with a TS/SCI clearance to provide support to a Government Office at WPAFB, Ohio. The Data Analyst’s primary focus will be to provide data analysis expertise during the design, development, and use of a complex data platform that seeks to aggregate data from multiple sources, with varying quality and contexts, drawing useful conclusions to answer key customer questions. This will require working with technology in the following areas: data pipelines, data warehouses, data mining, big data visualization, data reporting, and automation. Implementations should utilize industry standard data analysis concepts and toolsets. Ultimately furthering the Government’s acquisition strategy goals and objectives managed by AFLCMC.TRAVEL WITHIN CONUS MAY BE REQUIRED UP TO 15%.Responsibilities Understand key questions that need to be answered, identify the data products required to provide relevant analysis, and implement solutions to ensure data provenance Collaborate across multiple integrated product teams to understand their problems and preform analysis to provide answers Apply industry best practices while implementing solutions for data collection and analysis Automate processes wherever possible including data cleaning and analysis report generation Research and develop statistical models for analysis purposes; collaborate with external partners to inform the development of their models Understand and validate the statistical approach used in creating any pre-existing models Close the feedback loop to continually improve models as new data is ingested into the platformQualifications B.S. degree in computer science, mathematics, or related field. Desired M.S. degree in computer science, mathematics, or related field. 2+ years data analysis experience and demonstrated expertise in relevant software development frameworks. Software programing experience (MATLAB/Simulink, Python, R). AI / ML model development experience and demonstrated expertise in relevant software development frameworks. Candidate should have demonstrated abilities to understand difficult problems, distill large amounts of data, derive relevant conclusions from data analysis, and communicate results effectively. The candidate must be a motivated self-starter who is able to work both independently and in a collaborative team environment, often with minimal guidance and within rigid timelines. The candidate must have the ability to communicate requirements clearly with external partners. The candidate must have the ability to apply their skills in a fast-paced environment where more than one project may require their attention at any given time. The candidate should have familiarity with contractor and government roles in aerospace system development and acquisition. Experience with the MS Office Suite of products. Must possess a minimum of Secret security clearance with the ability to obtain a Top Secret Security Clearance. Duties will require unescorted entry and work within classified SAP and SCI facilities. Must have 12 months or more of experience in a SAP environment within the last 5 yearsPlease Note: U.S. Citizenship is required for this position, due to contract requirements.Additional Notes Travel: Position requires up to 15% travel to CONUS areas.#MTSI2022-6540Show moreShow less

job title: R&D Software Engineer - Hybrid Work Location
job description: Tenet3 is a growing cybersecurity and systems analytics firm in Dayton, OH. We provide solutions through software and services to government and commercial customers working on technical cybersecurity problems. We are looking for flexible software engineers who can drive the engineering of R&D projects.R&D software engineers work in teams with security engineers and R&D scientists to support capability development. R&D software engineers have an experimentalist's mindset, are not discouraged by failure, and are motivated by a broad-based interest in cyber, data analysis and visualization, scalable computing and modern DevOps processes. R&D Software Engineers enjoy a competitive salary, a very generous benefit package, an informal but productive working environment, and daily engagement with the company's brilliant and collegial staff. Continuous learning and skill development are emphasized during an Engineer's tenure at Tenet3.Responsibilities with Approximate Effort50% - Develop technical solutions that support research and technology development needs. Actively participate in the R&D and cyber engineering process by supporting the design and development of technology stacks for bleeding edge technology. Work with Engineering and our Product Solutions teams to build requirements and support the transition of research proof of concepts and prototypes into agile DevSecOps processes. Effectively document the development process and experimental results.50% - Interface with research, software development, and customer solutions teams to understand software and service requirements. Propose new R&D systems of benefit to the company and our customers.RequirementsBA/BS in Computer Science or related field.Ability to obtain a U.S. Department of Defense security clearance.Knowledge and experience in Python.Knowledge of software engineering life cycles, documentation, and design modeling. Ability to work independently and drive your own products.Ability to work in a dynamic environment, working multiple projects simultaneously. Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills.An open and friendly attitude and willingness to work in a team.Team-player attitude able to take and offer direction to others. Preferred QualificationsMS or PhD in computer science or related technical field.Experience with Flask/Django.Experience developing against AWS or other cloud computing platforms.Experience with data science workflows in Python. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.A previously obtained DoD security clearance.Salary And BenefitsHybrid optional work location with periodic office visitsVery competitive salaryGenerous PTOAdditional sick daysFloating holidaysExcellent health benefits including 100% medical, vision, and dentalHSA with company contributions401(k) Retirement Plan with company match and profit sharingShort and Long-term DisabilityLife InsuranceCasual environment with smart, creative peopleFlex timeFree coffee and snacksAbout Tenet3Tenet3 is a cyber analytics company based in Dayton, Ohio. We develop software products supporting advanced machine learning, property graph analysis, and enhanced human cognition. Our tag line is Cybernetics . We seek synergies between human insights and machine automation. Working together our software platforms and human analysts enable a concept we call "explainable security." This offers our customers a unique window into the trustworthiness of complex, interconnected, cyber-physical systems. Successful software drives our growth. We need you and your talents to drive our success.Tenet3 provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, religion, age, disability, gender identity, results of genetic testing, or service in the military. Equal employment opportunity applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leave of absence, compensation, and training. provided by DiceShow moreShow less

Company DescriptionJob Description Our Global Data & Analytics team is the hub of harvesting and analyzing data to drive strategic, customer-centric business decisions for our brands. By collaborating with partners across a broad variety of business functions, associates on our D&A team provide recommendations that allow our teams to push boundaries and stay at the forefront of retail trends.As our data and technology capabilities continue evolving, D&A will need to play a consultative role in helping the business understand WHY and HOW machine learning and AI can benefit the organization and WHERE these techniques can be leveraged to drive value.This individual will be the liaison between the business and the Data Science functions to ensure business opportunities are being properly captured and translated into technical requirements for development of ML models and applications.What Will You Be Doing? In this role, the individual will be responsible for managing the end-to-end lifecycle of all data science models AND applications. This includes:Works with business functions (marketing, customer, merchandising, planning, digital product, supply chain, etc.) to understand business needs, assess/vet opportunities and identify problems best suited to be solved by data science solutionsManages stakeholder requests, gathers requirements, conducts initial t-shirt sizing around level of impact (LOI) and level of effort (LOE); prioritizes requests into data science product roadmap; collaborates with data science managers to ensure successful executionFollows industry trends in retail data analytics/machine learning practices; contributes ideas and actively participates in POC’s of new technologiesWorks with data science managers to design solutions, including but not limited to:Conducts research & discovery to identify viable options to solve business challengesIdentifies which data sources are required to solve the problemIdentifies which data sources exist vs. what may need to be sourced externallyRecommends analytics/modeling techniques that are best suited to solve for business needsBriefs data scientists and/or data engineers, providing requirements & specifications for developmentReviews development / model outputs to ensure alignment back to requirementsManage project progress and delivery milestonesProvides detailed stories on key insights, findings, and recommendations in a digestible and actionable manner to stakeholders and leadership through polished presentations.If application is developed, works with business to provide training, support and ongoing maintenanceWhat Do You Need To Bring? Bachelor's degree required (master’s preferred) in disciplines related to data science, data analytics, mathematics or engineering, or other fields of science/technology5-7 years working in a consultative role within the data, analytics, and technology domain3-5 years of hands-on experience using SQL, Python and or R to wrangle data and develop modelsStrong understanding of data science concepts and their applications to the business (Regression, Decision Trees, Clustering, Classification methods, Optimization Methods, etc.)Basic understanding of data engineering conceptsAbility to simplify complexed technical topics and distill down for a business audienceStrong written and verbal communication skillsHighly organized; proven ability to effectively multitask between several projects and competing priorities in a dynamic business environmentStrong networking, interpersonal and relationship building skillsExperience operating in an agile environment, operating in sprints, and leading standupsOur CompanyAbercrombie & Fitch Co. (A&F Co.) is a global retailer of five iconic, omnichannel lifestyle brands catering to the kid through millennial customer: Abercrombie & Fitch, abercrombie kids, Hollister, Gilly Hicks and Social Tourist. At A&F Co., we’re here for our associates, customers and communities on the journey to being and becoming who they are – and because no journey is the same, we strive to create an inclusive culture, where everyone is free to share ideas. Our Values We lead with purpose and always put our people first, which is evidenced by our Great Place to Work™ Certification, as well as being a 2021 recipient of Fortune’s Best Workplaces in Retail, and named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ+ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign for 16 consecutive years. We’re proud to offer equitable compensation and benefits, including flexibility and competitive Paid Time Off, as well as education and engagement events, including various Associate Resource Groups, volunteer opportunities and additional time off to give back to our global communities.What You'll GetAs an Abercrombie & Fitch Co. (A&F Co.) associate, you’ll be eligible to participate in a variety of benefit programs designed to fit you and your lifestyle. A&F is committed to providing simple, competitive, and comprehensive benefits that align with our Company’s culture and values, but most importantly – with you! We also provide competitive incentives to reward the commitment our associates have for moving our global business forward:Incentive Bonus Program Paid Time Off and Work From Anywhere Flexibility Paid Volunteer Day per Year, allowing you to give back to your community Merchandise Discount Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Available Life and Disability Insurance Associate Assistance Program Paid Parental and Adoption Leave Access to Carrot to support your unique parenthood journey Access to Headspace dedicated to creating healthier, happier lives from the inside out 401(K) Savings Plan with Company Match Opportunities for Career Advancement, we believe in promoting from within A Global Team of People Who'll Celebrate you for Being YOU Additional InformationABERCROMBIE & FITCH CO. job title: Financial Crimes Data Science Sr. Manager
job description: ABOUT THE JOB (JOB BRIEF) Reporting to the Director of Financial Crimes Modeling & Analytics that reports to the Chief Modeling and Analytics Officer, the Data Science Senior Manager is primarily responsible for leading a quantitative team in support of financial crime modeling and analytics. This role must establish priorities for the team, assign and define the work to the right resources, and understand the strengths and opportunities of the team to ensure the team meets and exceeds expectations. This role is responsible for owning modeling practices, methods, and techniques as well as for influencing data strategy with a focus on leveraging both current and emerging technologies and applications. The Data Science Senior Manager acts as a leader, strategic advisor and credible thought partner to senior / executive level business partners. This position is also responsible for managing the integration of activities within and across teams as well as effectively manage, coach, develop, and guide a team of professionals to anticipate business needs, recommend solutions that are both effective and efficient, and communicate the right message.   ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONSOversee a small quantitative team (2-4 direct reports) in developing models and conducting analytics to address financial crime compliance needs in AML/BSA/OFAC Research, compile and evaluate large sets of data to assess quality and determine suitability for model building Develop/maintain internal models and test/configure vendor solutions to ensure conceptually sound design, proper implementation, and acceptable model performance Employ innovative techniques to drive continuous improvements in model effectiveness and efficiency, e.g. reducing false positives Proactively coach and develop the team on building technical skills and business knowledge; promote the team and their capabilities to stakeholders Effectively collaborate with compliance, technology, and risk partners; guides, advises, challenges, and influences to drive organizational impact Provide strategic consultation and thought leadership to senior / executive level business partners   REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS  Master's degree (or its equivalent) in statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science, data sciences, predictive modeling, or other quantitative disciplines and at least 6 years of relevant experience, preferred in AML/BSA, OFAC, or fraud modeling/analytics Solid expertise with both traditional and Machine Learning (ML)/Artificial Intelligence (AI) modeling practice and solutions Hands-on work experience with statistical coding in SAS and/or Python Knowledge of and ability to leverage traditional databases, cloud-based computing, and distribution computing In-depth understanding of financial crime regulatory requirements, technology, and data analysis best practices Demonstrated direct management experience Excellent verbal, written and visual communication skills; ability to define and communicate key risk metrics, dashboards and analytics for senior management and executive reporting; translate technical observations to a non-technical audience A credible thought leader that can guide, advise, challenge, and influence at all levels of the organization and drive organizational impact     Show moreShow less

POSITION OBJECTIVEThe objective of the position is to provide data management, statistical design and analysis support to cancer-related epidemiological and health services projects using population-based databases. The analyst will play a leadership role in all aspects of data analyses, data management and report generation for these research projects. The analyst will be integrally involved in all aspects of research project design, quality assurance monitoring, preparation of research reports and grant applications within the School of Medicine, in other parts of the university, as well as with partner institutions (e.g., University Hospitals, Cleveland Clinic, VA, and Metro Health). This position functions under minimal supervision. Data sources will include but are not limited to novel prospective data collection efforts; EMR data mining; cancer registry data (OCISS and SEER); U.S. Census data; CDC vital statistics and other social determinants of health datasets. The analyst will be integrally involved in statistical design and planning for all research; quality control and assurance (QA/QC) monitoring; and preparation of statistical summaries, including research reports. Experience in multivariable modeling techniques, and familiarity with statistical software such as SAS and/or R is essential.Essential FunctionsStudy Design – Work with the Principal Investigator and with other investigators on the projects to develop appropriate methodologies for addressing study hypotheses, using population-based databases. Participate in the research design phase of projects and in the preparation of research proposals for funding. This work will be comprehensive and will include developing approaches for data management, assuring the integrity of the data, and methods for implementing data analysis. (10%)Data Analysis – Consult with clinical investigators and other statisticians on the team to determine appropriate statistical approaches. Independently perform statistical programming and analysis for multiple research studies. Create analytic datasets, summarize data, and create reports. Work with other team members to develop and implement analytic approaches including but not limited to graphical analyses of data, multiple linear regression, logistic regression, methods for correlated data, and survival analysis. Objectively assess appropriateness of final models using model diagnostics of final statistical models. Document methods and results via written memoranda and reports. (25%)Data Procurement and Management – Work with other clinical and programming personnel to design, develop, generate and maintain appropriate databases, using SAS and/or R. Develop programs and protocols to ensure data integrity (e.g., logic and range checks; QA/QC). Perform intermediate statistical programming for quality assurance. Develop efficient data archival systems for use and maintains detailed written documentation of all data programming and data archival systems. Prepare documentation for all the steps involved in preparing an analytic program file, including creation of code and datasets with detailed annotation and data dictionaries, to be organized and catalogued for later use by the investigators. (25%)Prepare Research Reports – Assist in the writing and preparation of research papers, grant proposals, including internal documentation, presentations, and other tasks, as needed. (10%)Development of Educational Opportunities – Work with other personnel to develop workshops and written materials to assist medical and graduate students and post-docs to learn about methodological and programming issues involved in working with population-based data, with emphasis on data management and reporting. (10%)Provide consultation for medical and graduate students working on large database projects in the areas of study design and data analysis, as well as provide instruction to other team members on techniques in which they have expertise. (10%) Nonessential FunctionsDefine workflows and data flows associated with research projects and other projects as assigned. (5%)Perform other duties as assigned. (5%)SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITYNot applicableQualificationsExperience: 3 years of work experience in an increasingly responsible position in biomedical research or social science research environment housed in a university, nonprofit research organization or similar setting.Education: A Master's degree in epidemiology, health services research, or biostatistics or related degree is required.Required SkillsClose familiarity and ability to work with population-based, public use databases related to public health.Statistical skills for analysis of multivariable data and production of graphical summaries.Statistical skills for data analysis, including analysis of longitudinal data. Statistical programming skills using SAS and/or R, including data visualization skills.Ability to learn new technologies quickly and without formal training, and use of new software or high-level coding languages, such as ArcGIS or Python.Ability to work semi-independently with direct but limited guidance.Being flexible, demonstrating initiative, strong planning/organizational/problem-solving skills, and fostering teamwork.Excellent oral and written communication skills in English, flexibility and the ability to interact with a diverse and large research team (statisticians, investigators, clinicians, and programmers). Desirable skills include background/understanding of medical terminology, and clinical/translational research.Ability to interact with colleagues, supervisors, and customers face to face. Ability to meet deadlines and demonstrate consistent attendance. Ability to use Microsoft office suite products such as Word, Power Point, Excel and Access.Interest in and/or knowledge of cancer research and health disparities is highly desirable.Ability to conduct analysis in a HIPAA-compliant manner and maintain human subjects research training certifications.WORKING CONDITIONSGeneral office environment. Work requires regular use of a computer keyboard and mouse. Limited manual dexterity required. Work requires negligible physical exertion. No exposure to hazards.Employee will be expected to obtain and maintain certification of training in human subjects research through an online course and exam and other seminars. The position may require occasional work with investigators at the Cleveland Clinic and/or MetroHealth Medical Center, and might require occasional travel to either of these locations. No travel outside the Cleveland area is anticipated. This position may be eligible for the staff hybrid work program pending approval.In employment, as in education, Case Western Reserve University is committed to Equal Opportunity and Diversity. Women, veterans, members of underrepresented minority groups, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.Case Western Reserve University provides reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. Applicants requiring a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process should contact the Office of Equity at 216-368-3066 to request a reasonable accommodation. Determinations as to granting reasonable accommodations for any applicant will be made on a case-by-case basis.Case Western Reserve University has implemented a COVID Vaccination policy requiring evidence of COVID-19 vaccination for all students, faculty and staff with an on-campus presence. Religious and medical exemptions may be provided in accordance with applicable federal and state laws. For more information go to: https://case.edu/equity/covid-19-accommodations. Applicants may contact the Office of Equity at 216-368-3066 /equity@case.edu for information regarding religious or medical exemptions as an accommodation.Show moreShow less

DescriptionTuvli, an Akima Company , is dedicated to providing our customers with superior, integrated technology and program support services and solutions. Our systems engineering, information technology, information assurance, program support and project management staff work closely with customers to ensure that our solutions are directly aligned with their business processes and desired program outcomes. We emphasize affordability, and delivering the best value for technology investments. Our personnel enjoy competitive benefits packages and challenging roles in work environments committed to innovation, diversity and opportunity for career growth. As an Alaska Native Corporation (ANC), 100% of our company's profits go back to our 14,300 Iñupiat shareholders that have resided near and above the Arctic Circle for more than 10,000 years. Our business helps support their way of life and contributes to the survival of a culture that has thrived in a challenging environment.Job Responsibilities Evaluates data and uses data analytics and data visualization to develop a variety of visually appealing and easy to interpret products to clearly communicate complex data sets and J/TIP priorities to the public and other stakeholders. Develops informational products such as charts, diagrams, maps, and graphics for senior management and other staff. Analyzes data and uses data visualization techniques to showcase human trafficking patterns and trends. This includes monitoring data quality and removing inaccurate data. Works closely with or advises all J/TIP teams to further the mission and priorities of the office related to this portfolio. The Data Analyst will also coordinate with other PE team members to make the office website and intranet Share Point site user-friendly, content-rich, and dynamic. This position will also support the development of reports and other written product for internal and external audiences. One example of this would be to perform statistical analysis of data for annual performance indicators. When needed, the Data Analyst will communicate, and may give presentations, on data and information to ensure staff understand data content.QualificationsMinimum Qualifications: Bachelors' degree (preferably in computer science or in a related field like math, statistics, or computer engineering). Ability to demonstrate capacity to work with large amounts of data, extract relevant information, and draw logical conclusions. Ability to translate complex data into non-technical, lay terms, especially for the general public. Demonstrated ability to pay attention to detail when working with data in order to highlight trends and patterns. Possesses subject matter expertise in knowledge of statistical methodologies and data analysis, and a comprehensive understanding of relevant databases, data sources, data organization. Skilled in Tableau, Share Point, and/or Microsoft Power BI. Expert in Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Office Suite. Previous experience or education in human rights or work with vulnerable populations. Demonstrated ability to communicate complex issues in a timely and concise manner, both orally and in written form. Strong IT and mathematical skills. Active Secret Clearance. 3-4 years of data analyst or related experience.The duties and responsibilities listed in this job description generally cover the nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this position. This is not intended to be a complete list of all duties, responsibilities, and skills required. Subject to the terms of an applicable collective bargaining agreement, the company management reserves the right to modify, add, or remove duties and to assign other duties as may be necessary. This is an opportunity to unleash your passion for software by contributing to real production code.Responsibilities Work with team members to maintain and construct custom Microsoft applications. Work collaboratively within a project team. Develop third-party software integration. Contribute to application frameworks that will be used by multiple products. C# ASP.NET Web development SQL Server development Familiarity with Software Design Patterns a plus Familiarity with agile development process a plusEducational Requirements Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science or a related field.Resurgent is fueled by our diverse and inclusive work environment. Are you excited about this opportunity, but your skills and experience aren't an exact match? We encourage you to apply anyway! You may be just the person we are searching for to fill this or another position. We would love to consider you for the Resurgent team!Technically speaking, Resurgent Capital Services manages domestic and international debt portfolios. But, if you were to ask any of our employees what we do, you might get a slightlydifferent response.They might tell you that we create opportunities out of challenging situations. For ourselves. And for our clients. It's what we call "building bridges." And here at Resurgent, we're building stronger bridges every day. Founded in 1998 and located in Greenville, SC, Resurgent works with some of the nation's largest credit grantors and debt purchasers. Our employees share common values that are embodied in the people who make our company their home. Our employees' actions are guided by "Results-Driven Process Management" or RPM-a rigorous measurement of financial and operational performance. This process, coupled with our people, has enabled Resurgent Capital Services to achieve industry-leader status. Whether dealing with customers directly or indirectly, our employees are trained in a variety of disciplines. Management. Operations. Collections. Financial or statistical analysis. Information Technology. In every discipline, regardless of position, all of our employees bring energy and high standards to the work we do.Show moreShow less

Dates: 5/22/2023 - 8/11/2023Shift: Hybrid, in office Tuesday & Wednesday, remote Monday, Thursday, & FridayLocations: Columbus, OH or Merrillville, INThe 12-week paid NiSource Internship program starting May 22nd, is a multi-faceted development experience that provides our interns with challenging and meaningful work that impacts the communities we serve.As a NiSource intern, you will have the opportunity to learn from senior leadership and build professional relationships with employees across our company.The NiSource Internship program also incorporates workshops to learn about NiSource, the energy industry and infuses learning and development opportunities that sharpen your professional skills. The robust program will aid in building the fundamentals needed to enter the energy workforce upon graduation.These positions will be a great opportunity for the candidate desiring to launch their career in the IT field. Successful applicants will build professional relationships with other interns and all levels of NiSource personnel while participating in rewarding professional development exercises and fun, team-building activities. Interns will obtain a broad overview of NiSource's operations and current events in the utilities industry.Internships are available in the following IT departments:Enterprise ArchitectureEnterprise Architecture is responsible for creating the technology strategy and roadmap. This team is responsible for developing standards and guidelines that should be used in planning, designing and implementing Information Technology applications and platforms. This team works collaboratively with other groups to drive the architecture vision for NiSource.IT ServicesIT Services supports the delivery of IT Application and Infrastructure services, including hardware and software asset and configuration management, for all NiSource business units. This role works with the Manager of IT Service Integration, Manager of IT Service Governance, and other Technology Tower Leads to ensure that Infrastructure and Application Services are fully integrated and delivered within the scope of Service Provider Contracts as reflected by service levels, statements of work and pertinent schedules/exhibits.InfrastructureInfrastructure and network delivery primary responsibility is to provide network technical design leadership and to oversee execution of processes associated incident, problem, change, asset, and configuration management within this technology domain. This includes working with enterprise architects, program managers, IT analysts, and managed service providers to effectively manage infrastructure operations and support delivery of projects. It also includes development and periodic review of ITIL based processes and practices to ensure highly available operations and compliance with architecture standards and strategies.IT SecurityThe IT Security organization is responsible for the resolution of IT Security incidents, preparation and planning for future IT security threats, and reviews security trends, threats and vulnerabilities. This role will work on a project to develop and execute a specific cyber incident response scenario exercise and develop a broad-view perspective of the cybersecurity space. The intern will work across towers to understand the interrelationships between IT Operations processes, and our company as a whole.IT ApplicationsThe IT Applications Developer Job Family encompasses job responsibilities and accountability for various IT applications development, system administration, and support functions necessary to ensure a stable and reliable application environment for NiSource. The application environment encompasses mission critical information systems such as Gas distribution, Hydro and Electrical Grid control systems, Electronic Measurement and other business critical applications. The job also includes the analysis and development of business applications, system interfaces, and other duties related to application system development lifecycle.Business AnalyticsThe Business Analytics Intern will leverage their skillset in areas such as data discovery, modeling, and visualizing results to identify and discover patterns throughout the business. Through collaboration with business units, this professional will be capable of acquiring, cleansing and structuring data from multiple sources to deliver key analytics based insight to drive business decisions.You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.Experience listed below could be obtained through a combination of school work, classes, research, or any relevant previous job or internship experiencesPlease include any Architecture, Networking, Operating Systems, Data Structures, C++, Python, Security, Technical Writing, Databases, Business Programming, Finance, Data Visualization, Business Intelligence, Information Systems, Enterprise Systems, SAP, ServiceNow, SharePoint and/or ERP coursework, school projects, GitHub, or internship(s) related experience on resumeQualifications:Actively pursing an undergraduate degree in Computer Information Systems, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Computational Sciences, Data Science, Finance, Technical Communication, Business Administration or a closely related fieldCompleted at least one year of undergraduate studyPrior experience working on group projectsAuthorized to work in the United States without requiring sponsorshipAbility to work 40 hours per weekIn addition to the qualifications listed above, the ideal candidate will also demonstrate the following traitsExcellent oral and written communication skillsWorks well independently and able to develop solutions for complex problemsAbility to interface with peers and managers to provide detailed updatesKnows how to plan, organize tasks, and work independentlyAbility to learn new technology quicklySolid skills in utilizing computers, operating systems, mobile devices and basic software (ex: MS Office products)DisclaimerThis description is not designed to be a complete list of all duties
