POSITION OBJECTIVEThe position will work under moderate supervision. The RA1 position involves research on a variety of metabolic disorders with the objectives to create and characterize cultured cell models of the disorders, and then carry out assays that test various strategies to correct the genes causing them. The responsibilities of the position are to 1) develop and characterize the cell models, 2) collect and analyze sample generated from the project, and 3) assist in the overall operations of the lab, including monitoring supplies and general lab duties. This position will function under the umbrella of the Research Institute for Children’s Health, the goal of which is to explore therapeutic approaches for rare, genetic diseases.Essential FunctionsPerform enzyme assay experiments, must be coordinated and data recorded for statistical analyses. (25%) Perform laboratory procedures, including eukaryotic cell culture, molecular biology and mass spectrometry. This will include mutagenesis and maintenance of cell lines, PCR to assess mutagenesis and gene expression, and mass spectrometry assays to assess enzyme activities. (40%) Conduct analysis of samples. The data generated from the experiments must be analyzed, including both summary statistics as well as comparisons of sample means and variation. (10%) Maintain laboratory records. This includes not only experimental data records, but also cataloging cell lines and other samples (DNA, RNA, protein) generated. of experiments. (10%)Maintain laboratory equipment/instrumentation utilized in experiments and equipment. Thermalcyclers for PCR, cell culture facilities and gas chromatography mass spectrometer (GCMS) must all be maintained. (6%)Order laboratory supplies. Reagents for PCR and cell culture, as well as disposables for experiments must remain stocked. (6%)Nonessential FunctionsPerform other duties as assigned; which may include shipping samples to collaborators, and assisting other lab members when needed. (3%)CONTACTSDepartment: Daily contact with the supervisor and a research associate who will serve as the project director to discuss research and obstacles encountered.University: Little to no contact anticipated, but there may be occasions where materials or information could be exchanged between labs.External: Occasional contact with collaborators to exchange research material or data.Students: Regular contact with 1 to 2 students for training and oversight responsibilities during undergraduate summer internship program in the principal investigator’s laboratory.SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITYThis position has no direct supervision of staff.QualificationsEducation/Experience: Bachelor’s degree in science and 0 to 1 year of experience or Associate's degree in an approved biotechnology program and 0 to 2 years of laboratory experience.Required SkillsHas knowledge of commonly-used concepts, practices, and procedures in sample preparation of cultured cells and animal tissues for analysis by mass spectrometry. Relies on instructions and pre-established guidelines to perform the functions of the job, such as cell culture and mass spectrometry. Ability to operate laboratory equipment and instrumentation, specifically thermalcyclers and mass spectrometer.Ability to meet consistent attendance and work in a team environment.Ability to interact with colleagues, supervisors and collaborators face to face.WORKING CONDITIONSGeneral molecular biology laboratory environment. Will have exposure to chemical hazards, such as organic solvents, acids, and bases. Personal protective equipment, including lab coat, gloves and goggles, will be provided to limit exposure to hazards. No physical exertion required. No travel required, but attendance at scientific meetings will be offered for presenting research results.In employment, as in education, Case Western Reserve University is committed to Equal Opportunity and Diversity. Women, veterans, members of underrepresented minority groups, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.Case Western Reserve University provides reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. Applicants requiring a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process should contact the Office of Equity at 216-368-3066 to request a reasonable accommodation. Determinations as to granting reasonable accommodations for any applicant will be made on a case-by-case basis.Case Western Reserve University has implemented a COVID Vaccination policy requiring evidence of COVID-19 vaccination for all students, faculty and staff with an on-campus presence. Religious and medical exemptions may be provided in accordance with applicable federal and state laws. For more information go to: https://case.edu/equity/covid-19-accommodations. Applicants may contact the Office of Equity at 216-368-3066 /equity@case.edu for information regarding religious or medical exemptions as an accommodation.Show moreShow less

Job Title: Risk Assessment InternshipJob Code: INT030The 12-week NiSource Internship program starting May 22nd, is a multi-faceted development experience that provides our interns with challenging and meaningful work that impacts the communities we serve. As a NiSource intern, you will have the opportunity to learn from senior leadership and build professional relationships with employees across our company. The NiSource Internship program also incorporates workshops to learn about NiSource, the energy industry and infuses learning and development opportunities that sharpen your professional skills. The robust program will aid in building the fundamentals needed to enter the energy workforce upon graduation.Job SummaryThe NiSource risk assessment team uses a new probabilistic risk model to assess the condition of the gas transmission and distribution systems. The team works with a complex model that uses hundreds of variables, factors, and questionnaire data to split the pipelines into thousands of dynamic segments to produce quantifiable risk values, based on each segment's unique conditions. The team uses the model to identify 'needle in the haystack' risks that could be otherwise missed, identifies areas for data improvement, and improves decision making and prioritization of pipeline assessments, replacements, and other risk reduction activities. Model maintenance requires iterative and detailed analysis to ensure model validation and maintain synchronicity with changing data sources and attribution. A successful summer intern candidate will assist with the detailed work of analyzing and validating the risk model results, data sources, formulas, factors, and produce action able reports and results.Successful candidate must be capable of working virtually, in the office as well as a hybrid model of both scenarios.**Location Flexible - Ohio, Indiana, Maryland, Kentucky, Pennsylvania or Virginia**Principal Duties And Responsibilities Risk Results: Work with Lead to analyze risk results using Business Intelligence tools to view and create outputs as directed.Risk Model and Data Validation: Analyze threats and data from risk results. Review resulting probability and consequence calculations. Recommend model or data updates. Review and update questionnaire data.What-if Analysis: Perform what-if analyses as assigned. Possible activities include, risk analysis for MAOP remediation decision making, replacements or installation analysis, ILI retro fit prioritization, or risk reduction measures.Analytical Assessments: Work with lead to develop or update analytical models to perform key business data analyses as directed.Internal Guides: Work with Lead to develop and update company documentation or user manuals for Synergi Pipeline that are in-line with company standards and procedures.Successful candidate will start in summer 2023Required Qualifications For PositionCurrently enrolled in a college or university acquiring a degree with a focus in data science, engineering, statistics, mathematics or related fieldHave completed at least one year of undergraduate studyStrong data skills and experience working with large and complex data setsExperience with Microsoft productsStrong written and verbal skills to communicate results of analysisKeen attention to detail and a quality focused mindsetSelf-discipline for planning and organizing tasksAbility to begin internship in May 2023Authorized to work in the United States without requiring sponsorshipPreferred Additional Qualifications For PositionExperience with GIS or other mapping systemsExperience with Business Analysis and Data Visualization Tools (PowerBI, Tableau)DisclaimerThe preceding description is not designed to be a complete list of all duties and responsibilities required of the position.Inclusion & Diversity Value inclusion within your day to day responsibilities by respecting others perspectives/convictions, engaging others opinions, creating a safe environment where people, ideas, and opinions are valued within your Team/Customers and external partners.Respect and take into consideration diversity within your Team/Customers and external work partners by valuing different world views, challenges, and cultures that represent all walks of life and all backgrounds.Treat others with respect and consideration. Actively participate in creating and contributing to a positive work environment.Equal Employment Opportunity NiSource is committed to providing equal employment opportunities in each of its companies to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin or ancestry, veteran status, disability, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any protected group status as defined by law. Each employee is expected to abide by this principle.By applying, you may be considered for other job opportunities. Safety StatementPromote a safe work environment by actively participating in all aspects of our employee safety program. Report any unsafe conditions and take actions to prevent personal injuries. Support our interdependent safety culture by ensuring the safety of your co-workers. Stay focused on the task at hand and promote productivity through good work habits.Posting Start Date:2023-01-10-08:00Posting End Date (if applicable):2023-01-25-08:00Please note that the job posting will close on the day before the posting end date.Show moreShow less

job description: Job SummaryOur corporate activities are growing rapidly, and we are currently seeking a full-time, office-based Entry Level Project Coordinator to join our Internal Data Monitoring team. Our mission is to accelerate the global development of safe and effective medical therapeutics through its scientific and disciplined approach. We leverage local regulatory and therapeutic expertise across all major areas including oncology, cardiology, metabolic disease, endocrinology, central nervous system, anti-viral and anti-infective. Headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, employing more than 5,000 people across 40+ countries. Why Medpace? People. Purpose. Passion. Make a Difference Tomorrow. Medpace Celebrates 30 Years As we celebrate 3 decades of industry expertise and organic growth, we recognize the global team responsible for driving clinical development at Medpace. job description: Screen reader users may encounter difficulty with this site. For assistance with applying, please contact hr-accessibleapplication@osu.edu. If you have questions while submitting an application, please review these frequently asked questions.Current Employees And StudentsIf you are currently employed or enrolled as a student at The Ohio State University, please log in to Workday to use the internal application process.In Order To Ensure Your Application Is Complete, You Must Complete The FollowingWelcome to The Ohio State University's career site. We invite you to apply to positions of interest.Ensure you have all necessary documents available when starting the application process. You can review the additional job description section on postings for documents that may be required.Prior to submitting your application, please review and update (if necessary) the information in your candidate profile as it will transfer to your application. Job TitleSenior Data Analytics SpecialistDepartmentMedicine | Catalyst CenterThe Senior Data Analytics Specialist will work on a variety of data management and statistical analytic tasks to inform emerging questions in Neurology Health Services Research including quantifying the value of neurologic care, evaluating approaches to optimizing neurologic systems of care and understanding factors that contribute to differential clinical outcomes by sociocultural status.Primary responsibilities will include data management for a variety of different datasets and types of data (e.g., Medical claims data, longitudinal survey data, survey data) and linkages across datasets. Provides extensive data management support to obtain and prepare data for analysis. Implements state-of-the-art solutions using code, evaluates the validity and reliability of the solutions, and improves on them as needed to ensure clarity and reproducibility. Designs, implements, tests, and improves methodologies for solving complex problems with minimal supervision. Based on analytic datasets developed from these primary data sources, the Senior Data Analytics Specialist will also contribute expertise in data analysis using a variety of statistical techniques in collaboration with experienced Health Services Researchers.Assists with summarizing conclusions and solutions for presentation. Contributes expertise in data visualization and description. Assists with proposal writing, the preparation of reports and the development of manuscripts. At the inception of studies, assists the team in selection of study design, identification of applicable data analysis strategies and pre-registration of data analysis plans. Participates in strategic decision-making regarding identification of follow-up research questions and optimal approaches to finding data-driven answers. Provides leadership to junior staff on small tasks. Works autonomously but with guidance from senior research staff. We welcome candidates with various types of analytical sophistication (expertise in statistics, mathematical modeling, data mining, network analysis, or data analytics) and seek individuals comfortable working outside of their expertise to learn new methods.Minimum Education And Experience RequirementsMaster's Degree in Statistics, Biostatistics, Epidemiology, Public Health, Applied Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science or relevant related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience.Expertise with statistical software (Stata preferred, but SAS, R, Python acceptable). About UsThe Ohio Department of Aging (ODA) is a cabinet-level agency within the executive branch of the Ohio state government. The director of ODA is a member of the Governor's cabinet, serving as principal advisor and advocate for 2.8 million older adults and their families. Through services, supports, and activities that cover a wide spectrum of issues, ODA strives to achieve its mission to foster sound public policy, research, and initiatives that benefit older Ohioans.ODA is the federally designated agency responsible for developing and administering multi-year state plans that advocate for, and provide assistance to, older Ohioans and their families. In addition to the centralized functions, the agency designates and contracts with community providers and a network of 12 Area Agencies on Aging, who manage a wide array of federal and state-funded supportive services. These services assist older adults to live as independently as possible; promote healthy aging and active community involvement; and support family members in their vital care giving role.To promote the agency's vision of Ohio - the best place to age in the nation, ODA actively collaborates with consumers and stakeholders from key associations, governments, and the public. The independent Office of the State Long-Term Care Ombudsman and the Board of Executives of Long-Term Services and Supports are also located within ODA.Our Core Values ArePromote Independence - Provide resources that foster independence and autonomy throughout the lifespan.Empower Communities - Deliver sustainable, relevant solutions that empower communities to act within the best interest of their elders.Challenge Ageism - Promote new perspectives of aging that challenge the traditional declinist narrative.Advocate for Excellence - Advocate with and for Ohio’s elders to ensure their voices are heard and their needs are met.Engage in Innovation - Engage the aging network by staying innovative, flexible, and attentive to the evolving needs of our partners and stakeholders.About The DivisionThe Information Systems Division (ISD) provides for the diverse technology needs of the department and Ohio’s aging network, supporting 25,000+ system users. The core teams within the division are:Technology Management administers Infrastructure and Operations, Data Management and Governance, Data Security and Compliance, and IT Service ManagementApplication Development and Management specializes in analyzing, designing, creating and maintaining computer software applicationsIT Strategy and Delivery Management oversees the processes, tools, and communication methods to continuously capture and translate business strategies into an aligned IT portfolio ensuring sustainable, value-driven outcomes.Design Innovation and Architecture continuously cultivates new ideas through diverse collaborations to innovate and influence new practice paradigmsToday’s approach to healthy aging is more holistic and connected than ever before. This means that our aging services platforms need to support a greater connected ecosystem where information and interoperability are essential for long-term success, person-centered care, and quality outcomes. Comprehensive platforms must connect the ecosystem to ensure that every part of the solution works together to create a positive, seamless experience, reducing manual work and advancing data analytics.The Division’s Current Objectives ArePartner of ChoiceBe an engaged and committed partner in defining, procuring, building, delivering, and managing aligned systems of supportOrganizational EfficiencyEnable efficient functional capabilities through automation, mobile and collaborative toolsets, and user experienceInnovationContinuously identify and incubate innovative solutions to contribute to the achievement of ODA’s goals and advance ODA’s missionControls and ComplianceModel with standards, laws, regulations, policies, rules, and guidelines where feasibleInformation Intelligence ProficiencyProvide high-quality data integration and advanced analytics to enable better informed decisions, problem solving, and risk analysisAbout The RoleWe are seeking an experienced Quality Assurance/Testing Specialist (Software Development Specialist 2) to work with business personnel, software developers, and business process analysts to assure that software systems are thoroughly tested as per the business and functional/architectural requirements. Job SummaryThe Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (EECS) at Cleveland State University (CSU) invites applications for a tenure-track Assistant Professor position in Computer Science/Data Science, to begin on August 21, 2023. CSU is committed to academic excellence and diversity within the faculty, staff, and student body. CSU is striving to be a nationally recognized and student-focused public research institution that provides accessible, affordable, and engaged learning opportunities for all.The search is part of the Cleveland Innovation District’s Talent Pipeline, a $565-million collaboration of a five-member consortium focused on healthcare and CS/IT programs. More information about the Cleveland Innovation District can be found here and here. Cross-institutional research and education are underway with the Cleveland Clinic, University Hospitals, The MetroHealth System, and Case Western Reserve University as well as other long-term partners including NASA Glenn, Rockwell Automation, and Parker Hannifin.While applicants who have demonstrated outstanding research in all areas of Computer Science/Data Science will be considered, the preference will be given to those in the following areas: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, Data Science and Analytics, Health Informatics, Graphics and Visualization, HCI, AR/VR/MR, Game design, Cyber Security, and Quantum Computing. The department encourages applications from historically underrepresented groups, including women, minorities, and persons with disabilities. Successful candidates should have completed their Ph.D. in Computer Science/Data Science or a closely related field by July 1, 2023.The faculty hired in this position will be expected to develop a strong, externally funded research program, supervise students, actively participate in teaching at both the graduate and undergraduate levels and provide services to the College and University.Minimum QualificationsAn earned Ph.D. in Computer Science/Data Science or a closely related field (Appropriate terminal degree completed by July 1, 2023).Show moreShow less

CAS uses intuitive technology, unparalleled scientific content and unmatched human expertise to help companies create groundbreaking innovations that benefit the world. As the scientific information solutions division of the American Chemical Society, CAS manages the largest curated reservoir of scientific knowledge, and for 116 years, has helped innovators mine, assess and apply that information to keep businesses thriving. The CAS team is global, diverse, endlessly curious and strives to make scientific insights accessible to innovators worldwide. CAS is currently seeking a Java/Scala Developer to join one of the teams that build applications for our Big Data architecture and Data Lake – the Content Engine. This position will be located in our headquarters in Columbus, Ohio. Technologies And Tools We Use To Build SolutionsHadoop, Scala, Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Apache Flink, Apache Iceberg, Cascading, Solr, Docker, AWS (many services and technologies), OpenStack, Jenkins, Maven, Git, Java, Groovy, JavaScript, Python, Jetty, REST, Node, Eclipse, IntelliJ, SQL, Linux, Gerrit, Junit, Ruby, Cucumber, Jira, Confluence, MarkLogic and others that we haven’t discovered yet.Job Responsibilities Participate on the CORE Platform Team which is developing our next-generation content platform to support the evolving content-processing needs of CAS software applications and products. Develop features to support an immense-scale knowledge graph of many data domains. This includes the ability to define and maintain data schemas, capabilities to ingest content into the knowledge graph, and capabilities to create subscriptions that pull data from the knowledge graph. Develop and maintain the AWS-based CORE platform operational features (e.g. alerting, monitoring, administration, etc.) and CI/CD capabilities. Support functional and performance testing of the CORE platform including scalability testing to ensure CORE-based applications can meet their production SLAs. Provide consultation and assistance to application teams building CORE-based solutions. This may include working on those teams for short intervals as they integrate with CORE APIs. Collaborate with teammates and product owners to groom backlogs of epics and stories for upcoming development sprints. Connect across the organization in our Communities of Practice to build influential working relationships, preparing your career for tomorrow. Stay abreast of the latest technology trends through individual and team training opportunities.Job Requirements 4-year degree in computer science or engineering, or equivalent job experience. Additional degree or experience in Data Science is a plus. Substantial internship or work experience outside of college curriculum. Leadership: willingness to provide ownership for team deliverables and to adopt CAS Operating Principles related to trust, organizational growth, team building, and team performance. Pair Programming: candidates need to be willing to pair with others when it makes sense. Clear Communication and Healthy Dialogue: candidates must be comfortable and eager to discuss work items and issues in team settings. Passion for Development: preference for candidates that actively learn on the job and outside of work. We are a team of developers that constantly seek to improve our craft and we expect to work with the same. Cross Functional Skill Development: willing to learn new skills and roles to meet the needs of their team.Highly Desirable Skills/Experience Application Delivery and Software Development: some experience is desirable. Big Data: any experience with the big data technology stack (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Scala, Kafka, Cascading, Solr, Flink, etc.) is highly desirable but not a requirement. AWS: some experience with AWS services like S3, EMR, EC2, Lambda and Cloudformation (and/or CDK) is highly desirable. Java and Scala/Spark Development: any full-stack experience creating enterprise applications with automated builds, automated deployments, shell-scripting, and operating domains using aJava-based technology stack (e.g. Java, Scala, Git, Jenkins, OpenStack, Docker, Maven etc.) is desirable. Quality Engineering: fundamental experience and knowledge of Automated Testing, Test-driven Development, debugging, troubleshooting, and optimizing code/automation is desirable.Chemical Abstracts Service (CAS), a division of the American Chemical Society, is the world’s authority for chemical information. CAS is the only organization in the world whose objective is to find, collect and organize all publicly disclosed chemical substance information. A team of scientists worldwide curates and controls the quality of our databases, which are recognized as the most comprehensive and authoritative by chemical and pharmaceutical companies, universities, government organizations and patent offices around the world. By combining these databases with advanced search and analysis technologies (SciFinder® and STN®), CAS delivers the most current, complete, secure and interlinked digital information environment for scientific discovery.CAS offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package, including a generous vacation plan, medical, dental, vision insurance plans, and employee savings and retirement plans. Candidates for this position must be authorized to work in the United States and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future. EEO/Minority/Female/Disabled/VeteranShow moreShow less

About UsThe Ohio Department of Aging (ODA) is a cabinet-level agency within the executive branch of the Ohio state government. The director of ODA is a member of the Governor's cabinet, serving as principal advisor and advocate for 2.8 million older adults and their families. Through services, supports, and activities that cover a wide spectrum of issues, ODA strives to achieve its mission to foster sound public policy, research, and initiatives that benefit older Ohioans.ODA is the federally designated agency responsible for developing and administering multi-year state plans that advocate for, and provide assistance to, older Ohioans and their families. In addition to the centralized functions, the agency designates and contracts with community providers and a network of 12 Area Agencies on Aging, who manage a wide array of federal and state-funded supportive services. These services assist older adults to live as independently as possible; promote healthy aging and active community involvement; and support family members in their vital care giving role.To promote the agency's vision of Ohio - the best place to age in the nation, ODA actively collaborates with consumers and stakeholders from key associations, governments, and the public. The independent Office of the State Long-Term Care Ombudsman and the Board of Executives of Long-Term Services and Supports are also located within ODA.Our Core Values ArePromote Independence - Provide resources that foster independence and autonomy throughout the lifespan.Empower Communities - Deliver sustainable, relevant solutions that empower communities to act within the best interest of their elders.Challenge Ageism - Promote new perspectives of aging that challenge the traditional declinist narrative.Advocate for Excellence - Advocate with and for Ohio’s elders to ensure their voices are heard and their needs are met.Engage in Innovation - Engage the aging network by staying innovative, flexible, and attentive to the evolving needs of our partners and stakeholders.About The DivisionThe Information Systems Division (ISD) provides for the diverse technology needs of the department and Ohio’s aging network, supporting 25,000+ system users. The core teams within the division are:Technology Management administers Infrastructure and Operations, Data Management and Governance, Data Security and Compliance, and IT Service ManagementApplication Development and Management specializes in analyzing, designing, creating and maintaining computer software applicationsIT Strategy and Delivery Management oversees the processes, tools, and communication methods to continuously capture and translate business strategies into an aligned IT portfolio ensuring sustainable, value-driven outcomes.Design Innovation and Architecture continuously cultivates new ideas through diverse collaborations to innovate and influence new practice paradigmsToday’s approach to healthy aging is more holistic and connected than ever before. This means that our aging services platforms need to support a greater connected ecosystem where information and interoperability are essential for long-term success, person-centered care, and quality outcomes. Comprehensive platforms must connect the ecosystem to ensure that every part of the solution works together to create a positive, seamless experience, reducing manual work and advancing data analytics.The Division’s Current Objectives ArePartner of ChoiceBe an engaged and committed partner in defining, procuring, building, delivering, and managing aligned systems of supportOrganizational EfficiencyEnable efficient functional capabilities through automation, mobile and collaborative toolsets, and user experienceInnovationContinuously identify and incubate innovative solutions to contribute to the achievement of ODA’s goals and advance ODA’s missionControls and ComplianceModel with standards, laws, regulations, policies, rules, and guidelines where feasibleInformation Intelligence ProficiencyProvide high-quality data integration and advanced analytics to enable better informed decisions, problem solving, and risk analysisThis position will be part of the network operations team and will report directly to the Assistant Chief Information Officer / Data Systems Administrator.About The RoleWe are looking for a solutions-oriented individual with demonstrated success in leading a team of three infrastructure specialists who are tasked with responsibilities such as infrastructure environment (e.g., Microsoft Office applications, workstations) support and server administration. The team responds to approximately 480 tickets per month.Additional Duties Include But Are Not Limited ToSets goals and standard operating procedures designed to achieve customer satisfactionOversees Foods people love. Brands people trust. And a career that nourishes your future like no other.If you're driven by the passion to do something meaningful that changes lives, Nestlé is the place for you. Nestlé USA is one of seven operating companies that make up Nestlé’s presence in the United States. We're in 97% of American homes, and as the leading food and beverage company, our goals are to continue to deliver quality food and beverage products, strengthen our local communities, and reduce our environmental and climate impact.We’re determined to challenge the status quo and be better tomorrow than we are today. As individuals and teams, we embrace our entrepreneurial culture and have created a workplace where collaboration is essential, courage is rewarded, speed is expected, and agility is the norm to delight our consumers every single day. Here, you will find limitless opportunities to learn and advance your career and feel empowered to succeed in the workplace and beyond. Because our focus is not only on nourishing our customers, but also about enriching you.This position is not eligible for Visa Sponsorship.You know us as the food and beverage company behind a lot of your favorites like Stouffer’s, Nesquik, Toll House, Lean Cuisine, and DiGiorno, as well as new discoveries like Sweet Earth and Chameleon Cold-Brew coffee. Across our organization, we are creating a workplace where collaboration is important, courage is rewarded, speed is expected, and agility is the norm to delight our consumers every single day.Reporting into the Senior Manager of Marketing Analytics, the Social Intelligence Lead will leverage the power of social listening and analytics to identify consumer tensions, augment brand research and evaluate marketplace opportunities for Nestle USA’s 30+ brands and other stakeholders across NUSA. They will see the stories within the data, combine them with context and then generate meaningful insights and strategies that drive the business forward.They will have a clear understanding of emerging social and digital media platforms and their benefits to the Nestle brand, and have proven experience providing actionable insights in an easy to digest manner. A proven multi-tasker, the Social Intelligence Lead must be comfortable handling multiple deadlines while always delivering consistent, quality work on time.The Social Intelligence Lead will also own the development and evolution of Nestle USA’s overall strategic roadmap for social listening and insights. Working cross-functionally, they will create and institutionalize a process for leveraging social intelligence to generate innovative consumer research and provide strategic recommendations. By harnessing global and NUSA resources, they will grow the social intelligence capability by identifying, training and empowering a team of social listening experts to meet research requests.PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES: Social Listening. Leverage social media listening tools to create timely research and reporting on consumer insights, marketplace trends, competitive analysis, product insights and emerging consumer tensions. Combine findings with other digital data sources, identify strategic recommendations and create persuasive presentations. Deliver findings to NUSA’s 30+ brands, consumer insights, HR, corporate communications, supply chain, and other internal stakeholders.Strategic Partnership with Brands. Partner with senior brand managers and other NUSA stakeholders to understand business objectives and hone social listening requests. Tailor findings and takeaways to the brand, assist in the design and presentation of recommendations, and support teams in implementing strategies stemming from research.Social & Digital Analytics. Advise and support NUSA social measurement, reporting and analytics across Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and TikTok. Work with community, social strategy and analytics teams to define successful community management KPIs and identify key benchmarks. Harness social data from native reporting and other sources to create recommendations and optimization strategies for NUSA properties.Technical and Technological Expertise. Remain abreast of the technologies and emerging solutions that will shape social and digital analytics in upcoming years. Be fluent in the data sets, structures, and systems that enable advanced social and digital analytics.Administration. Serve as the NUSA point of contact for Nestle’s larger global social intelligence capability, including managing agency relationships, participating on global social media councils, and helping other markets to leverage social listening to drive business performance. REQUIREMENTS AND MINIMUM EDUCATION LEVEL: Bachelor’s degree in relevant field, Master’s degree a plus6+ years of experience in social media listening, social insights, consumer research and/or digital analytics DESIRED EXPERIENCE: Experience using Sprinklr, Brandwatch or similar social media listening platform to generate consumer insights and strategic brand recommendationsStrong research experience and familiarity with the process for developing consumer and marketplace insightsUnderstanding of the social media landscape, dynamics of community interaction, social best practices, and digital analytics toolsExperience using social media measurement and analytics across the major social platforms to drive business performanceExperience successfully managing multiple projects simultaneously with limited supervision, collaboration and working successfully with multiple stakeholders and teamsStrong storytelling experience through the creation and presentation of compelling PowerPoint decksSolid communication skills and ability to communicate data-driven findings directly to mid- and senior-level managersStrong interpersonal skills and ability to network and work successfully with a wide range of stakeholdersAbility and patience in working with complex data across multiple sources. Comfort in working with the tools and platforms used to analyze data, create reports and model business performance ADDITIONAL PREFERRED EXPERIENCE: General experience in digital marketing a plus (e.g. report generation, marketing campaign analysis, web analytics, AB testing, email performance, social media measurement, content testing, etc.)Experience achieving proficiency in a range of analytics tools and data platforms used to extract and summarize data (e.g. Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Sales Force Marketing Cloud, PowerBI, etc.)Proficiency using Google Analytics or similar platform to evaluate website performance and derive actionable insights It is our business imperative to remain a very inclusive workplace.To our veterans and separated service members, you're at the forefront of our minds as we recruit top talent to join Nestlé. The skills you've gained while serving our country, such as flexibility, agility, and leadership, are much like the skills that will make you successful in this role. In addition, with our commitment to an inclusive work environment, we recognize the exceptional engagement and innovation displayed by individuals with disabilities. Nestlé seeks such skilled and qualified individuals to share our mission where you’ll join a cohort of others who have chosen to call Nestlé home.The Nestlé Companies are an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer seeking diversity in qualified applicants for employment. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, gender, gender identity, age, religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, perceived disability, medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other protected status, as defined by applicable law. Prior to the next step in the recruiting process, we welcome you to inform us confidentially if you may require any special accommodations in order to participate fully in our recruitment experience. Contact us at accommodations@nestle.com or please dial 711 and provide this number to the operator: 1-800-321-6467.This position is not eligible for Visa Sponsorship.Show moreShow less

job description: This role is with Bristol Myers Squibb. OverviewThe K-12 Science Education Program Administrator develops, organizes, and leads programming to provide opportunities for kindergarten through high school students to engage with biomedical research and science topics in a fun and enriching way. The administrator builds relationships with local schools to ensure equitable access to experiences for students from underrepresented populations. job title: Bristol Myers Squibb, Intern, Statistical Programming (Grad) (Summer 2023) - Application via WayUp
job description: This role is with Bristol Myers Squibb. WayUp is partnering with Bristol Myers Squibb to hire top talent.At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.Position SummaryThe candidate will learn to provide statistical programming support for clinical studies, learn to program CDISC datasets (SDTM/ADaM) and report the statistical study results with Tables, Listings and Figures. Perform quality process (QC) for datasets and tables, as well as other supporting activities for statistical programming group (ex. support programming for data visualization). Working with the different statistical programming teams, the candidate will also learn working in a team and interacting with the multiple stakeholders of Research & Development life cycle.Key ResponsibilitiesThe Summer Intern, assisting the statistical programming function will be expected to learn how to:Develop, review, validate SAS programs to generate Datasets, Tables, Figures and Listings.Support review of datasets specification (SDTM/ADAM) following the industry standards (CDISC) and related documents based on CRF, SAP and TFL shells.Understand Company SOPs and relevant industry’s standardsSupport implementation of tools to facilitate the data visualization (R-Shiny, Python)Support implementation of data exploration analysis (using R)Prepare final presentation to statistical programming group.Qualifications & Experience Recent BSc graduate in Computer Science, Life Sciences, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or related field with a minimum one year graduate school completed.Internship program will run for 10-12 weeks.Available to work up to 40 hours/week during normal business hours during intern.Knowledgeable of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).Good verbal communication skills, ability to write clearly and effectively.Knowledge of R/R-Shiny or Python is preferred.Knowledge of SAS language, procedures, and options for clinical trial data and reporting including BASE SAS, Macro language, SAS/STAT and SAS/Graph.Professional, proactive demeanor.Strong interpersonal skills.Ability to work collaboratively as part of a team.Be authorized to work in the US or corresponding region.Must not be employed at the time the internship starts. Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues. Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. Company Overview:Founded in 1929, Heinen’s is a premier grocery store chain noted for its quality products and outstanding customer service. Heinen’s has now welcomed the fourth generation into the company, which operates 23 stores (19 in Cleveland, Ohio and 4 in Chicago, Illinois), two distribution warehouses, one food production plant, and a corporate office (located in Warrensville Heights, Ohio). Culturally, we place an emphasis on quality of life for every associate within the organization. We offer this through a competitive compensation package, professional development and leadership opportunities, paid time off, and balanced work schedules.Job Summary:The Data Architect is a new role for Heinen’s, responsible for supporting our organization through delivery of scalable, flexible, cloud-based, and cost-effective solutions to support our enterprise data and business intelligence needs. This role will critically inform, and design change efforts related to our information solutions, beginning with a data warehouse redesign. The ideal candidate will be able to translate our organizational business needs and unique challenges to present ideal solutions for long-term success.Responsibilities:Leads solution architecture rebuild effort and ongoing optimization design for data warehouse.Supports organizational change management efforts related to data initiatives, including rollout of data governance program, and supporting processes.Provides technical project leadership from architecture to delivery of solution for data-rich implementations.Partners with others in evaluating new applications they may use to access data in their respective areas.Documents architecture solutions for multiple audiences.Defines and documents best practices for many data process, including ETL processes, data storage, and data cleansing, to support integration, data sharing, analysis, and business intelligence solutions.Partners in development of roadmap for data initiatives.Identifies opportunities for process improvement and/or optimization across greater organization to streamline workflow and create efficiencies.Leads requirements review process to understand business functionality impacts to methodological changes to business processes.Partners with development team and technical services team to support change implementation. Core Competencies:Tech Savvy – Anticipating and adopting innovations in business-building digital and technology applications.Manages Complexity – Making sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems.Decision Quality – Making good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward.Global Perspective – Taking a broad view when approaching issues, using a global lens.Action Oriented – Taking on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm.Communicates Effectively – Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences.Collaborates – Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.Optimizes Work Processes – Knowing the most effective and efficient processes to get things done, with a focus on continuous improvement.Manages Ambiguity – Operating effectively, even when things are not certain, or the way forward is not clear.Being Resilient – Rebounding from setbacks and adversity when facing difficult situations.Qualifications:7 years of experience architecting enterprise data solutions, including implementation of new solutions or rebuild/overhaul of current solutions.Experience architecting cloud data solutions across multiple technologies, including Azure and Snowflake.Strong ability to work with different databases and platforms.Experience working with many different types of data, including Financial, Marketing, PII, PCI, and PHI.Demonstrated knowledge of the appropriate database structures used to support different data.Able to work independently, and work as part of a team to implement a goal.Able to succinctly communicate complex principles, ideas, analyses, and solutions to team members across all levels of the organization.Experience identifying operational issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve problems.Able to work collaboratively with various functional areas to understand their needs and assist in developing solutions for data access.Superior technical leadership and innovative problem-solving abilities.Able to handle multiple priorities and meet concurrent deadlines.Strong organizational leadership, with demonstrated experience as a change agent.Heinen’s, Inc. provides equal employment opportunity to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. *This role is not eligible for VISA sponsorship*Show moreShow less

Job TitleResearch AssociateDepartmentPublic Health | Division of EpidemiologyThe Social Epidemiology to Combat Unjust Residential Evictions (SECURE) study is funded by the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation. In partnership with a Community Advisory Board of Black women leaders, the SECURE study will document, for the first time, the magnitude and severity of court-ordered and illegal residential evictions, as well as their impact on the health of Black families and communities in Metro-Detroit, MI. This mixed-methodology multi-level study will prioritize community power and agency, and center the voices, experiences, and ways of knowing of Black women. The SECURE study is unapologetically, *FOR US, BY US* and our work is grounded in HOUSING IS A HUMAN RIGHT and BLACK LIVES MATTER. You can learn more about the project at www.securestudy.org.SECURE study research associate will be responsible for qualitative and quantitative data collection, analysis, and dissemination efforts. They will participate in recruiting, data collection, data cleaning, data analysis, community advisory board and other stakeholder engagement, as well as training and support of any additional hired personnel for the project. The research associate will assist with writing and broadly disseminating products of the research project to public and academic audiences.Required ExperienceMaster of Science in a Public Health discipline or related field, or equivalent combination of education and experience.Preferred Experience Community-based mixed methods research; Using quantitative epidemiologic methods with relevant statistical software (multi-level analyses, longitudinal data analysis) and/or Quantitative data analysis experience with relevant software (grounded theory, coding, thematic analysis) Writing for scientific audiences (peer-reviewed publications, white papers, briefs, info-graphics, etc.)Essential Job Duties60% - Conduct qualitative and/or quantitative data analysis using statistical software including (but not limited to) SAS, atlas.ti, stata, ARCGIS20% - Assist with writing for scientific publication as well as data dissemination through other avenues (op-eds, news media, etc.)10% - Ability to effectively communicate with Black women from Metro-Detroit Michigan, and encourage study participation.10% - Engage and effectively communicate with relevant community based stakeholdersApplicationPlease submit a cover letter describing your interest in and qualifications for this position in addition to a CV/resume.Additional InformationPay rate: $30-35/hrOhio State is focused on enhancing the health and safety of our community. Therefore, the university is requiring every student, faculty and staff member to be compliant with Ohio State’s COVID-19 vaccine requirement. By the start of employment, all newly hired employees must receive at least the first dose of a two-dose series or a single dose of a one-dose series COVID-19 vaccination. Individuals who choose a two-dose series vaccination must receive the second dose within 45 days of their start date. Proof of vaccination will be required at time of hire. Candidates may request a medical or religious exemption from the vaccination requirement. Campus employees may also request an exemption for personal reasons. Ohio State Wexner Medical Center, College of Medicine or OSUP Employees are not eligible for personal exemptions. All exemptions are subject to Ohio State’s approval and subject to change, including revocation, due to legal and regulatory requirements.Location:Remote LocationPosition TypeRegularScheduled Hours20ShiftFirst ShiftFinal candidates are subject to successful completion of a background check. A drug screen or physical may be required during the post offer process.Thank you for your interest in positions at The Ohio State University and Wexner Medical Center. If you’re passionate about becoming a Nationwide associate and believe you have the potential to be something great, let’s talk.This role is compensation grade F4 This is a REMOTE OPPORTUNITY.This opportunity is a role on the ‘Marketing Data, Analytics, and Research’ team in Marketing Operations, supporting enterprise and brand marketing across all business units. The selected individual will be responsible for the design, build, and delivery of data products that drive advanced multi-channel marketing campaigns, measurement of campaign effectiveness, and predictive analytics/models. As a Specialist, you'll actively participate in all phases of the marketing and advertising analytics life cycle. You will partner with internal customers in determining data and information needs and in identifying information to aid with decision making. You’ll build sophisticated data and analytic solutions using modern platforms and business intelligence tools. You will serve as the lead to others for information and data needs.This opening can be filled in one of our offices, or in a remote/work-from-home (WFH) capacity from anywhere in the country. This can include responsibility for business and data analytics projects, including development and maintenance of intermediate statistical models and related analyzes. This can also include developing the business understanding vital for analytics projects, obtaining and leading related data, performing analyses, interpreting results, outlining requirements for analytical solutions as needed, providing insights to internal clients and helping implement insights to marketing decisions.You also may work on projects through one or more of the delivery cycles from initiation, solution scoping, design, development, and analytic execution through implementation. assists with the business alignment and scoping sessions.Assists in gathering, analyzing and interpreting a wide variety of underlying data to support business, customer and/or financial objectives; able to identify new ways to combine business data to improve business processes and marketing and business outcomes.Helps with the initiative to build and/or improve existing statistical models to solve business problems; defining requirements for sophisticated machine-learning models; implementing testing strategy and assists in putting final models into production.Assists with interpreting statistical/analytical results and creating a feedback loop for analyzes improvement.Builds data visualization to support business needs.Helps designs and implements qualitative and quantitative research projects and methodologies used to measure consumer perceptions and satisfaction.Helps drive marketing action and results through the interpretation and application of data and research findings.Helps facilitate business implementation planning sessions.May facilitate post-implementation checkpoint with business units to ensure best in class solutions are implemented.Works with leader to influence change and gain support from leadership and key partners for the development of new processes and methodsAssists with developing governance, documentation and training around new processes.May Perform Other Responsibilities As Assigned.Reporting Relationships: Reports to Director/Manager. Job SummaryOur laboratory activities are growing rapidly, and we are currently seeking a full-time, office-based Data Coordinator to join our Data Management team in the Medpace Reference Lab. This position will work on a team to accomplish tasks and projects that are instrumental to the company’s success. If you want an exciting career where you use your previous expertise and can develop and grow your career even further, then this is the opportunity for you.ResponsibilitiesMaintain daily routine maintenance over assigned studies via edits, data queries, data changes, and Data Management sample management;Manage and resolve processing errors and inconsistencies daily to ensure client commitment is met (i.e., problem samples, missing samples, misrouted samples, sample testing);Ensure continuous maintenance/follow-up over study assignments to prepare for study timelines (i.e., data locks, study close-out, etc.);Communicate with other internal functional groups and external clients (i.e., sites, vendors, sponsors) on study progress; andAssist in the preparation of Data Management documents.Qualifications Bachelor's degree in a Life Science related field, Business, or Communication;Strong attention to detail; andWorking knowledge of Excel and Word. Medpace OverviewMedpace is a full-service clinical contract research organization (CRO). We provide Phase I-IV clinical development services to the biotechnology, pharmaceutical and medical device industries. Our mission is to accelerate the global development of safe and effective medical therapeutics through its scientific and disciplined approach. We leverage local regulatory and therapeutic expertise across all major areas including oncology, cardiology, metabolic disease, endocrinology, central nervous system, anti-viral and anti-infective. Headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, employing more than 5,000 people across 40+ countries. Why Medpace? People. Purpose. Passion. Make a Difference Tomorrow. Join TodayThe work we’ve done over the past 30 years has positively impacted the lives of countless patients and families who face hundreds of diseases across all key therapeutic areas. The work we do today will improve the lives of people living with illness and disease in the future. Medpace Celebrates 30 Years As we celebrate 3 decades of industry expertise and organic growth, we recognize the global team responsible for driving clinical development at Medpace. Click here to learn more about Medpace Celebrating 30 Years. The OrganizationDise & Company, a retained executive search firm, is privileged to represent our client, the world's largest professional society of metals-centric materials scientists and engineers, dedicated to informing, educating and connecting the materials community to solve problems and stimulate innovation around the world. The society serves as a central resource for gathering the latest applied information and disseminating it back to industy, acadamia and government through published content, classes, annual events, SaaS tools and materials data platforms that aid capabilities within manufacturing organizations and across engineering disciplines. Position SummaryThe Materials Engineer - Digital Products will be ultimately responsible for revenue generation and growth in a primarily B2B sales environment. The role will focus on growing a recently launched business unit that features SaaS and materials data platforms that aid in elevating Materials Science capabilities within manufacturing organizations and across engineering disiplines. The role will have sales responsibility of Digital Content including quantitative databases, digitized reference content, as well as newly developed products. Critical to success will be the ability to prospect, qualify, relationship build, and close new customers as well as penetrate new markets. The successful candidate needs to execute and own the prospecting and development of new customers, the engagement of exisitng relationships, and the collaboration on product direction and strategy. The role will focus on the growth of digital content products through corporate subscriptions working with a team of production, inside sales, and management personnel to achieve planned growth goals each year. Specific ResponsibilitiesIdentify, develop and grow focus markets that apply to SaaS tools, data platforms, and digital content offerings; this can range from Fortune 500 companies to small/mid-size materials intensive organizations. Utilize available internal and external resources to create targeted lists.Build a pipeline of opportunities through phone conversations, targeted email, and face to face meetings. Become proficient at understanding and using digital products, be able to relate to the use cases of our customers and how they will gain value from our information. Identify and attend conferences, networking events, customer sites in an effort to develop leads and opportunities. Manage all sales activity using Salesforce.com and keep the data up to date daily. Produce proposals and make pricing decisions. Negotiate and close opportunities while handling complaints and objections. Achieve quarterly and annual revenue goals. Business/Professional RequirementsUndergraduate degree in Materials Science, Metallurgy or Physics5+ years of direct sales experience with technical, value-added products in a B2B environment Prior experience with Salesforce.com is a plusExcellent communciation skills (written, phone, presentation, etc.)Willingness to travel 20%-30% of the timeHybrid work environment.To ApplyDise & Company will review all applications and resumes submitted via this job posting. Appropriate candidates will be contacted by a member of the recruiting team for telephone screening. Any candidate selected for a face-to-face interview will be asked to prepare a Letter of Interest.Show moreShow less

job title: Statistical Analyst - Telecommuting and or Office Based
job description: We are currently seeking a Statistical Analyst to help support our Operations and Technology Consulting department. Please note that this position may be eligible for remote work, and/or has the option to be based in one of our offices (Cincinnati, OH, Santa Monica, CA, Boca Raton, FL, or Jersey City, NJ).What We'll Bring To The TableCompetitive salary (salary range: $55,000 - $65,000)Flexible Work ProgramClear opportunities for career progressionCompany-funded professional educational programGenerous benefits including PTO, medical/dental/vision insurance, 401(k) with matchFriendly, dynamic work environmentVisible management commitment to our Company Core Values of: Our core values are: Diversity & Inclusion; Environmental, Community and Employee Wellbeing; Excellent Work Product; Innovation; Integrity and Superior Customer ExperienceWhat You'll Be DoingFormatting, reviewing and validating insurance company statistical data feeds reported to industry regulators on behalf of insurance companies Running formatting and data validation programs, evaluating data quality results, performing financial reconciliations and creating analysis reports for clientsAssisting in consultations with clients which includes providing explanations of edit results, recommendations for coding and financial changes and updating companies on reporting requirementsWhat You'll Bring to the TableA Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university is preferredExperience within the property and casualty insurance industry is preferredProficiency with Microsoft Office products, specifically Excel, Access and OutlookWorking knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server is a plusStrong desire to take ownership of projectsAbility to prioritize and multi-task in order to meet established deadlines Excellent inter-personal, verbal and written communication skillsStrong attention to detailAbout Perr&KnightFounded in 1994, Perr&Knight provides insurance consulting and software solutions to the property & casualty and accident & health industries. We provide peace of mind to more than 1.6 million Ohioans through our high-quality health, life, disability, dental, vision and indemnity plans. We offer fully insured and self-funded group coverage, including stop loss, as well as Medicare Advantage, Medicare Supplement, and individual plans.The Business Intelligence Programmer Analyst is responsible for transforming business requirements into BI technical solutions that efficiently enable analytics capabilities to be deployed in support of business and strategic objectives of the enterprise. This role must provide subject matter leadership and expertise on the technical solution of a BI project to support analytic deliverables and capabilities. Business Intelligence Programming Analyst II Independently transforms business requirements into BI technical solutions that efficiently enable analytics capabilities to be deployed in support of business and strategic objectives. Job TitleReporting and Analytics SpecialistDepartmentArts and Sciences | Center for Career and Professional SuccessUnder the supervision of the Assistant Dean of the Center for Career and Professional Success (Career Success), utilizes valid and reliable research methods (both qualitative and quantitative) to gather, analyze and report data describing center activities and impact. Leads initiative to obtain career outcomes data. Creates and delivers reports and presentations via multiple media to a wide range of constituents, including College of Arts & Sciences academic departments/advisors, research centers, faculty, industry, and institutional partners. Develops and implements assessment strategies relevant to new and ongoing initiatives and programs and to identify opportunities for operational efficiencies. Acquires outcomes data from primary or secondary sources to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns of employable skills from an Arts & Sciences education. Leads activities to track and coordinate strategic initiatives and successful implementation of organizational goals. Advises Career Success Administration on College and institutional policies. Represents Career Success at meetings, conferences and on committees as needed or by request of the Assistant Dean. Collaborates and coordinates with other staff, including Career Success’ Administration, Industry Connections, Career Communities, and Operations teams. Supervises one full-time staff member and two part-time paraprofessional staff members. The position includes occasional weekend and evening work, and the successful completion of background check(s) including professional references and criminal history.Required QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Quantitative or Qualitative Psychology, Education Evaluation, or an appropriate discipline in the Arts & Sciences. Experience with queries, report writing and presentation findings. Knowledge of excel, SPSS, Qualtrics and Tableau. Demonstrated ability to conduct large-scale database analysis and survey research in an applied setting, including development of instruments, reaction of meaningful variables, sampling, content and timing. Ability to perform thematic and qualitative data analysis.Desired QualificationsAdvanced degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Quantitative or Qualitative Psychology, Sociology, Political Science, Education Evaluation, or an appropriate discipline in the Arts & Sciences. Experience working in a higher education setting. Experience working with senior college administration, faculty and institutional research administrators. Knowledge of experiential learning and impact on student career outcomes. Experience with career management systems (preferably Handshake). Demonstrated public speaking and writing skills to be used on behalf of the college as a whole and Career Success specifically.Additional InformationReporting and Analytics Analyst 1, S1The target hiring range for this position is $22.16-$29.57Ohio State is focused on enhancing the health and safety of our community. Job SummaryOur imaging services are rapidly growing and we are currently seeking a full-time Software Engineer to join our team developing applications for the analysis and quantification of medical images (CT, MRI, etc.) using advanced techniques such as artificial intelligence and deep learning.Responsibilities Design and develop image quantification applications using advanced techniques such as artificial intelligence and deep learning; integrate these applications into Medpace’s image management systemConduct unit testing, participate in software validation process through development, review and execution of test scriptsFollow the company’s software development lifecycle processes in a highly regulated environment (drug development)Communicate with team members regarding projects, development, tools, and proceduresProvide end-user support including setup, installation, and maintenance for applications releasedWrite technical documentation Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent, or higherExcellent programming skills, at least 2 years of software development experienceKnowledge of standard image processing techniques (segmentation, registration, etc.)Experience in machine learning or deep learningOther appreciated skills/knowledge: Programming languages: C#, python, javascript, typescriptCloud systems (Azure, AWS, etc.)Machine/deep learning frameworks ( TensorFlow, Keras, etc.)Code management tools: TFS/DevOps, git.Excellent analytical, written and oral communication skillsTRAVEL:NoneMedpace OverviewMedpace is a full-service clinical contract research organization (CRO). We provide Phase I-IV clinical development services to the biotechnology, pharmaceutical and medical device industries. Our mission is to accelerate the global development of safe and effective medical therapeutics through its scientific and disciplined approach. We leverage local regulatory and therapeutic expertise across all major areas including oncology, cardiology, metabolic disease, endocrinology, central nervous system, anti-viral and anti-infective. Headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, employing more than 5,000 people across 40+ countries. Why Medpace? People. Purpose. Passion. Make a Difference Tomorrow. Join TodayThe work we’ve done over the past 30 years has positively impacted the lives of countless patients and families who face hundreds of diseases across all key therapeutic areas. The work we do today will improve the lives of people living with illness and disease in the future. Medpace Celebrates 30 Years As we celebrate 3 decades of industry expertise and organic growth, we recognize the global team responsible for driving clinical development at Medpace. Click here to learn more about Medpace Celebrating 30 Years. job title: Bristol Myers Squibb, Intern, Statistical Programming (Undergrad) (Summer 2023) - Application via WayUp
job description: This role is with Bristol Myers Squibb. WayUp is partnering with Bristol Myers Squibb to hire top talent.At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.Position SummaryThe candidate will learn to provide statistical programming support for clinical studies, learn to program CDISC datasets (SDTM/ADaM) and report the statistical study results with Tables, Listings and Figures. Perform quality process (QC) for datasets and tables, as well as other supporting activities for statistical programming group (ex. support programming for data visualization). Working with the different statistical programming teams, the candidate will also learn working in a team and interacting with the multiple stakeholders of Research & Development life cycle.Key ResponsibilitiesThe Summer Intern, assisting the statistical programming function will be expected to learn how to:Develop, review, validate SAS programs to generate Datasets, Tables, Figures and Listings.Support review of datasets specification (SDTM/ADAM) following the industry standards (CDISC) and related documents based on CRF, SAP and TFL shells.Understand Company SOPs and relevant industry’s standardsSupport implementation of tools to facilitate the data visualization (R-Shiny, Python)Support implementation of data exploration analysis (using R)Prepare final presentation to statistical programming group.Qualifications & Experience Current enrollment in pursuit of BS in Computer Science, Life Sciences, Mathematics, Statistics, EngineeringInternship program will run for 10-12 weeks.Available to work up to 40 hours/week during normal business hours during intern.Knowledgeable of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).Good verbal communication skills, ability to write clearly and effectively.Knowledge of R/R-Shiny or Python is preferred.Knowledge of SAS language, procedures, and options for clinical trial data and reporting including BASE SAS, Macro language, SAS/STAT and SAS/Graph is preferred.Professional, proactive demeanor.Strong interpersonal skills.Ability to work collaboratively as part of a team.Be authorized to work in the US or corresponding region.Must not be employed at the time the internship starts. You could be the one who changes everything for our 26 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.Remote AvailablePosition Purpose Analyze integrated and extensive datasets to extract value, which directly impacts and influences business decisions. Work collaboratively with key business stakeholders to identify areas of value, develop solutions, and deliver insights to reduce overall cost of care for members and improve their clinical outcomes.Interpret and analyze data from multiple sources including healthcare provider, member/patient, and third-party data.Support execution of large-scale projects with limited direction from leadershipIdentify and perform root-cause analysis of data irregularities and present findings and proposed solutions to leadership and/or customersManage multiple, variable tasks and data review processes with limited supervision within targeted timelinesSupport the design, testing, and implementation of process enhancements and identify opportunities for automationApply expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how customers interact with analytic productsSupport multiple functions and levels of the organization and effectively, both verbally and visually, communicate findings and insights to non-technical business partnersIndependently engage with customers and business partners to gather requirements and validate resultsCommunicate and present data-driven insights and recommendations to both internal and external stakeholders, soliciting and incorporating feedback when requiredEducation/ExperienceBachelor’s degree in business, economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, public health, health informatics, healthcare administration, finance or related field or equivalent experience. 2+ years of experience working with large databases, data verification, and data management, or 1+ years IT experience. Healthcare analytics experience preferred. Working knowledge of SQL/query languages. Preferred knowledge of programmatic coding languages such as Python and R. Knowledge of statistical, analytical, or data mining techniques including basic data modeling, trend analysis, and root-cause analysis preferred. Preferred knowledge of modern business intelligence and visualization tools including Microsoft PowerBI.Our Comprehensive Benefits Package Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility, Competitive pay, Paid time off including holidays, Health insurance coverage for you and your dependents, 401(k) and stock purchase plans, Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development.Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different.
